Mrs. Virginia is a member of the communal bank Miraflores and lives in the city of Cuenca, which is the capital of the province of Azuay.  It is known as the "Athens of Ecuador", the cultural city of the country, and is also modern and attractive.  Cuenca offers the best and most important production of crafts in the country.  Its varied gastronomy captivates the palate of locals and foreigners, alike.  Its people keep alive the local culture and traditions.

Virginia is 37 years old, has a common-law husband and six children, ages 21, 16, 13, 6, 3 and 2.  She is very happy because she is eight months pregnant.  Her eldest son works and helps out economically.  Two of the children are in school and the youngest son goes to preschool.  Her husband is a heavy truck driver and they own the home they live in.

Virginia sells all kinds of clothing and has been in business for 16 years, working Sunday to Sunday.

The communal bank she belongs to is on their third loan, and she plans to use it to buy clothing to stock her business.  

Her goal is to travel around the world.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia, de 48 años es una mujer tímida. Vive en compañía de Teodor, su esposo desde hace 4 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos de los cuales cuida y cría a 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Jatumpampa.  “A pesar de lo cansado que es trabajar en la chacra, me gusta mucho”, comenta Taodocia, quien se dedica desde hace 30 años a sembrar papa, olluco y maíz en terrenos arrendados. No cuenta con unos propios, porque tuvo a muy corta edad que asumir responsabilidades dentro de su familia. Pero ese sueño todavía sigue y espera cumplirlo. Teodor, le ayuda siempre en el cuidado de sus cultivos, los que cuidan diariamente, ya que se caracterizan por ser de buena calidad. Por eso sus cosechas de papa, los comercializa a la capital del país, quienes llegan con camiones a sus terrenos a llevarse toda la rica papa que produce. Ya el maíz lo trasladan a la feria de la ciudad. Asimismo se dedica a la ganadería, tiene 30 ovejas las que pastan y engordan para luego venderlas a buen precio, “siempre tengo que quedarme con algunas para aumentar mi ganado”, afirma.  Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Teodocia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago del arriendo de su terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
48-year-old Teodocia is a shy woman.  She lives together with Teodor, her husband of 4 years.  The couple have seven children and they raise and care for two of them in their own home which is located in Jatumpampa.  "In spite of how tiring it is to work on the farm, I like it a lot", comments Teodocia, who has been sowing potatoes, olluco (a native tuber) and corn on rented land for 30 years.  She does not own land of her own because, at a very young age, she had to assume responsibility within her family.  However, she still has this dream and she hopes to fulfill it.  Teodor always helps her to care for the crops which they look after daily because they are noted for being good quality.  Her potato harvests are sold in the country's capital city.  People arrive at her land with trucks and take away all the delicious potatoes that she produces.  The corn is taken to the town market.  Teodocia also raises livestock.  She has 30 sheep that she pastures and fattens, and then sells at a good price.  "I always have to keep some back to increase my herd", she says.

This is Teodocia's third loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can carry out her plans.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Teodocia will invest the money she has requested in paying rental on her farmland.

loans.use: to rent a plot of farmland

loans.name: David

texts.es: David, de 19 años de edad, es un joven admirable. Vive en compañía de sus padres y 4 hermanos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Jatumpampa. Como hijo mayor, ayuda a sus padres en los gastos económicos del hogar. Actualmente divide su tiempo en los estudios de Computación y en la agricultura, principal medio económico. Hace 3 años comenzó por su propia cuenta a sembrar papa, olluco, alverja y habas en terrenos arrendados. Pus todavía no cuenta con unos propios, su objetivo es ahorrar lo necesario para poder adquirir uno. “Cuando obtenga mi propio terreno, tendrá más oportunidad para generar mayores ingreso”, afirma. Cuenta además que en cada cosecha viaja 2 veces por semana a la capital del país, donde comercializa sus alimentos a mayor precio. Paralelo a este trabajo compra ovejas, las que son alimentadas y cuidadas por parte de su mamá, para luego venderlas a un mayor precio cuando estén ensebadas. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Jatumpampa al progreso” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. David de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de útiles escolares y uniformes para sus hermanos. Ahora que comiencen a estudiar en la escuela.
texts.en:
David, 19, is an admirable young man who lives with his parents and four siblings in their own house, located in the town of Jatumpampa.  Since he is the eldest, he helps his parents with the household expenses.  He divides his time between studying computer science and farming, which is his main source of income. Three years ago he started growing potatoes, olluco tubers, peas and lima beans on rented land, since he does not have his own land yet.  His goal is to save enough to buy land.  "When I have my own land I will be able to generate more income.", he says.  Every harvest he travels twice a week to the capital to sell his produce at a higher price.  In addition to this work, he buys sheep which his mother feeds and takes care of so they can be sold at the best price when they are fully grown.  

He belongs to the communal bank "Jatumpampa al Progreso" and this is his first loan through MFP.  He is counting on your collaboration to help him meet his goals.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time and enjoys being a part of the association because all the members are responsible, supportive people.  If David receives your support, he plans to invest the loan in buying school supplies and uniforms for his siblings who are starting the school season.

loans.use: To buy school supplies and uniforms for his siblings.

loans.name: María Aquilina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Miraflores, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la capital de la provincia del Azuay,  es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador", la ciudad cultural del país, es también moderna y atractiva, Cuenca ofrece la mejor y más importante producción artesanal del país. Su variedad en la gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños. Su gente mantienen viva la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 44 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 22, 20, 18 y 13 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan  económicamente y su ultima hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
  
Ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría pollos y gallinas.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para los mismos.

Su sueño es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is a member of the communal bank Miraflores and she lives in the city of Cuenca, which is the capital of the province of Azuay.  It is known as the "Athens of Ecuador", the cultural city of the country, and is also modern and attractive. Cuenca offers the best and most important production of crafts in the country. Its varied gastronomy captivates the palate of locals and foreigners, alike. Its people keep alive the local culture and traditions.

María is 44, married and has four children, ages 22, 20, 18 and 13.  Her three oldest children work and help out economically and the youngest daughter attends school in the city.  Her husband works in construction and they own the house they live in.

She is a homemaker and, since she stays at home, also raises chickens and hens.

Her communal bank is on its second loan and she plans to use it to buy chickens and feed.

Her dream is to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: Juan Dios tiene 69 años de edad, su negocio a la que se dedica es a una fritanga este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus cliente, él ya tiene sus cliente fijos y eventuales que lo visitan apara consumir su servicio. Juan Dios tiene hijos pero no están a su cargo ya son mayores y le ayudan económicamente. Juan Dios esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, aceite, verduras, bolsas, entre otros productos para la fritanga.
texts.en: Juan Dios is 69 years old.  His business is selling fried food and it is located in his home.  This is where he serves his customers.  He has regular and occasional customers who visit him to eat his products.  Juan Dios has children but they are no longer in his care as they are adults and they help him out financially.  Juan Dios is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, oil, vegetables, bags and other products for his fried food business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables, bags and other products for making his fried food

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Hector, de 24 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de sus padres en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Acostambo. Se caracteriza por ser ingenioso, estudio la profesión de electricidad. Comenzó trabajando en una empresa conocida en ese rubro, ahí se especializó en soldadura, que afianzó en su anterior trabajo, que realizó en una mina importante; es muy bueno en lo que realiza, por eso ya todos lo conocen y de vez en cuando le piden asesoría, obtiene un dinero extra por ello. Pero hace poco obtuvo su propio auto, con lo que piensa trabajar en el trasporte público, cubriendo las rutas Huancayo, Jauja, dos ciudades muy concurridas, espera tener mucho éxito y poder generar más ingresos ya que su sueño es formar su propia empresa y tener una ganadería implementada. Para ello ya dio el primer paso en la compra de toros, los que deja al cuidado de su mamá, pues ella conoce del cuidado y mejoramiento de los amimales. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Hector de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de la línea de autos donde comenzará a trabajar.
texts.en:
24-year-old Hector is a responsible man.  He lives together with his parents in their own home which is located in the town of Acostambo.  Hector is noted for being clever.  He studied to be an electrician.  He started out working in this field for a well-known company, specializing in welding.  He financed this from his previous job which he carried out in an important mine.  He is very good at what he does and so everybody knows him and sometimes they ask his advice, for which he earns extra money.  However, a short while ago he obtained his own car and he plans to use it to work in the public transport business, covering the routes between Huancayo and Jauja, two very busy cities.  He hopes to be very successful and make more income because his dream is to set up his own business and own an established ranch.  He has already taken his first step by purchasing bulls which he leaves in his mom's care because she knows how to care for and improve animals.

This is Hector's first loan from MFP and he hopes to receive your cooperation so that he can carry out his plans.  For his part, he pledges to make his repayments on time.  He enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Hector will invest the money he has requested in paying for the taxi route that he will begin working on.

loans.use: to pay for a taxi route

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny, de 30 años es una hija ejemplar vive en compañía de sus padres y 3 hermanos a los que apoya en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad del Tambo. Cuando apenas terminó el colegio estudio la carrera de Ingeniería en sistemas, a petición de sus padres, confiesa que nunca le gusto, por ello no ejerció la profesión. Y comenzó a generar ingresos en el negocio de compra y venta de ropa y productos de belleza, que instaló en su casa. Al principio le constó mucho conseguir clientes, ofrecía de casa en casa su mercadería, con el tiempo y gracias a su esfuerzo ya tenía clientes conocidas, quienes la buscaban y hacían pedidos, Ahora tiene cuenta con numerosos pedidos de uniformes. Le va muy bien; que decidió estudiar la carrera que siempre le gustó “Ingeniería Civil”, le falta un año para terminarla y ya trabaja en la gobernación de su localidad, como supervisora de obras y gracias a su capacidad, hace poco un grupo de Arquitectos le solicitaron, que forme parte de su proyecto de construcción, donde obtendrá buenas ganancias mientras que dure el proyecto. Se siente feliz y tiene muchos planes de especialización, “mi camino todavía comienza, quiero especializarme en carreteras”, afirma.  Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, pues le agrada ser parte de su asociación. Yeny de recibir, su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de mochilas y uniformes para abastecer los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yeny, 30 years old, is a model daughter. She lives with her parents and three siblings who she supports in their own house, located in the area of Tambo. When she had only just finished school she studied a Systems Engineering degree, at the request of her parents. She admits that she never liked it, and has never worked in this activity. Instead she started to earn an income in the business of buying and selling clothes and beauty products, which she installed in her house. In the beginning she found it hard to find new customers. She went door to door with her products. Eventually and thanks to her hard work she made regular customers, who look for her and make orders.

Now she has various orders for school uniforms. Things are going well for her; She decided to study a degree which she was interested in - "Civil Engineering". She has one year left to finish and already works in the local council as a works supervisor. Thanks to her capability, a group of architects recently contacted her to form part of a construction project where she will obtain a good wage while the project lasts.

She is very happy and has many plans: "My road is just starting, I want to specialize in highways" she states. This will be her 1st loan with MFP, where she hopes to receive a small loan to carry out her objectives. Apart from this, she is committed to paying her quotas on time. She likes being part of this MFI. Yeny will invest the requested money in buying backpacks and school uniforms to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and backpacks.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, sus hermosas playas, su agricultura y por la generosidad de su gente, en sus tiempos libres le gusta mucho de salir a pasear por la ciudad, ya que siempre es bueno despejarse un poco nos comenta Luis, el es padre, tiene un hijo de 25 años, el cual le ayuda mucho en el negocio, como buen peruano le gusta la comida y uno de los platos que más le agrada es el riquísimo “arroz tapado”, Luis estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar medicina veterinaria.

Luis se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, el se levanta desde muy temprano para atender su negocio ya que atiende a los cerditos en cuanto a su alimento, limpieza de su corral para que puedan crecer con salud, le dedica alrededor de 15 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 4 clientes de manera mensual, pero en época de navidad y año nuevo siempre tiene aumento en la venta de los cerditos por las festividades, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque se dedica mucho a su negocio y porque lo hace con higiene y buenos alimentos por ello los clientes tienen confianza en él.

Luis está muy pero muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada el podrá comprar vacunas para los cerdos y mejorar los corrales donde viven, con esta mejora tendrá cerdos libres de enfermedad y en un mejor ambiente de crianza, con ello los clientes sentirán más confianza, lo que le permitirá tener más ingresos para seguir luchando y salir adelante y sobre todo cumplir uno de sus sueños:” ayudar en la educación de sus nietos”.
texts.en:
Luis lives in the city of Camaná.  This city is noted for its warm climate, its beautiful beaches, its farming, and the generosity of its people.  In his free time, Luis really enjoys going for walks around the city.  "It it is always good to clear your head a bit", he says.  Luis is a father.  He has a 25-year-old son who helps him a lot in his business.  Like all good Peruvians, Luis enjoys food and one of his favorite dishes is the delicious 'arroz tapado' (molded rice with a ground beef filling).  Luis studied up to the fifth year of his secondary education but he would have liked to go on to study veterinary medicine.

Luis' business is raising and selling pigs.  He gets up very early in the morning to work in his business as he must feed his piglets and clean out their pens so that they can grow healthily.  He spends around 15 hours a day in his work and can serve up to four customers a month.  However, over the Christmas and New Year period he always has an increase in his sale of pigs because of the festivities.  He believes that his business is going well because he puts a lot into his business and because he works with hygiene and good feed.  For this reason, his customers trust him.

Luis is very, very grateful indeed to Kiva lenders because, with the help they provide, he will be able to buy vaccines for his pigs and improve the pens where they live.  This improvement will mean that his pigs will be free from illness and be raised in a better environment.  This, in turn, will mean his customers will trust him more and he will make more income so that he can continue working hard and doing well.  Above all, he would like to fulfill one of his dreams: "to help with my grandchildren's education".

loans.use: to buy vaccines and to improve his pens

loans.name: Enma Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Enma es socia del banco comunal Miraflores, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la capital de la provincia del Azuay,  es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador", la ciudad cultural del país, es también moderna y atractiva, Cuenca ofrece la mejor y más importante producción artesanal del país. Su variedad en la gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños. Su gente mantienen viva la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Enma está pidiendo otro préstamo, ella formaba parte de otro banco comunal pero como es una mujer muy emprendedora realizo un nuevo grupo para dar oportunidades a nuevas mujeres.

Doña Enma se encuentra muy bien de salud al igual que toda su familia. Ella es comerciante y se dedica la venta de comida hace 3 años, actividad que la realiza porque le gusta la cocinar y es un buen trabajo para salir en adelante con su familia.

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo ha invirtió en la compra de vajilla y víveres para su negocio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en mesas y víveres para crecer más en el negocio. En el pago de su crédito no ha tenido dificulta y realizo la cancelación total a la fecha. La banca comunal le gusta ya que en cada reunión conversa con sus amigas de varios temas de su interés.

Su meta es de ir creciendo con su negocio
texts.en:
Mrs. Enma is a member of the communal bank Miraflores and lives in the city of Cuenca, the capital of the Azuay Province. It is known as the "Athens of Ecuador", the cultural city of the country, and is also modern and attractive. Cuenca offers the best and most important production of crafts in the country. Its varied gastronomy captivates the palate of locals and foreigners, alike. Its people keep alive the local culture and traditions.

Enma used to belong to another communal bank but since she is a very enterprising woman she set up a new group to give opportunities to new members, and is requesting another loan.

Emma and her family are all very healthy.  She has been in the business of selling food for three years because she likes to cook and finds this to be a good source of income for her family.

The money from the previous loan was used to buy dishes and food ingredients for her business.  She plans to use the new loan to buy tables and food ingredients to expand her business.  She had no difficulties paying back the previous loan and was able to pay it on time. She enjoys the communal bank because she and her friends discuss interesting topics.

Her goal is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy tables and food ingredients.

loans.name: Los Sauces (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Los Sauces está formado por 6 socias y 2 socios quienes son personas trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy amables, laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten  solventar los gastos de su hogar. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca que la capital de la provincia del Azuay, es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador", declarada Ciudad Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en Diciembre de 1999.  Cuenca ofrece la mejor y más importante producción artesanal del país, cuenta con renombradas joyerías, obreros especialistas convierten el oro y plata en bellas joyas; su gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de propio y extraños. Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. Martha, tiene 23 años de edad, es soletera y vive independiente, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señorita. Martha labora como empleada privada, actividad que la desempeña hace un año y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue  invitada por una amiga. Con su primer crédito va a comprar CD de música y video para poner un local y comenzar con este negocio.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The 'Los Sauces' community bank is made up of 6 women and 2 men who are hard-working, tenacious and very kind people.  They work every day in different business activities which allow them to cover their household expenses.  They live in the city of Cuenca, which is the capital of Azuay province.  It is well known as being the 'Athens of Ecuador'.  It was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999.  Cuenca offers the best and most important production of handicrafts in the country.  It has well-known jewelers, specialist workers who turn gold and silver into beautiful jewels. Its cuisine is very wide ranging and delights the palates of both locals and visitors.  The local people maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

One of the members of this group is Martha.  She is 23 years old, single, and lives independently.  She does not own her own home but lives in a rental house.

Martha works as a private employee.  She has been in this job for one year and she works from Sunday to Sunday, from 9.00am to 9.00pm.  This is her first loan through her community bank, which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will use her first loan to buy music CDs and videos so that she can set up a sales location and start a business.  Her goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy music CDs and videos

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es: Marta Esmeralda tiene 45 años de edad, el negocio a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general , este negocio lo emprende por la necesidad generar ingresos y sufragar los gastos del hogar, ella ya tiene experiencia en el negocio es por ello que sus clientes la visitan frecuentemente por la variedad de productos que le ofrece a sus clientes. Maria Esmeralda esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos como camisas, blusas, short, zapatos, variedad de cosméticos, pantalones entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Maria Esmeralda is 45 years old. She makes a living in the business of selling general supplies. She started this business due to the need to bring in an income to cover the household bills. She has experience in this business and because of this her customers visit her often for the variety of products she offers. 

Maria Esmeralda is requesting a loan to buy products such as shirts, blouses, shorts, shoes, various cosmetics, trousers as well as other products.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, shorts, shoes, various cosmetics, trousers as well as other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Herbalife products.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 42 años, está casada y junto a su esposo tienen 6 hijos a los cuales quiere mucho, Lucia es muy amorosa y en sus tiempos libres le gusta pasear con sus nietas, ella vive en la ciudad de mala, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y por su actividad principal que es la agricultura, Lucia como buena peruana le gusta la comida y por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”, ella curso estudios secundarios, pero por los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres no pudo continuar estudios superiores.

Lucia trabaja en su negocio de venta de desayunos, raspadillas, gaseosas, entre otros, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 45 clientes al dia, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio debido a que es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene sazón para la preparación de los desayunos.

Lucia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva porque con la ayuda brindada ella podrá comprar más mercadería (gaseosas, golosinas entre otros), ya que ella desea aumentar los productos para vender, con esta mejora ella tendrá mas variedad de productos para ofrecer y le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos para asi seguir luchando y poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Darle profesional sus hijos y tener un local propio”.
texts.en:
Lucia is 42 years old, married and with her husband she has 6 children she loves very much. Lucia is very loving and in her free time she loves to take her grandchildren out. She lives in the city of Mala, which is known for its hot climate and whose main business is farming. As a good Peruvian, Lucia loves food and one of her favorite dishes is "Lomo Saltado". She finished secondary school but due to her parents' lack of economic resources she was unable to continue her studies. 

Lucia has a business where she sells breakfast food, shaved ice, soda and more. She works about 10 hours a day and has as many as 45 customers in a day. She thinks her business is going well because of her friendliness with her customers and because she cooks very tasty breakfasts.  

Lucia is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, which she will use to buy more merchandises (sodas, candy, etc). She would like to expand the products she sells in order to offer her customers more variety and hopefully increase her profits. Her dream is to afford professional studies for her children and to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (soda, candy, etc).

loans.name: Celia Flora

texts.es:
Celia es una mujer muy luchadora esta casada y junto a su pareja tienen un hijo de 13 años, el cual cursa el segundo año de secundaria, su esposo siempre está a su lado apoyándola en todo a pesar de que él trabaja realizando mantenimiento a la carretera panamericana sur, siempre se da un tiempito para darle ánimos y ayudarla; ella es muy creativa y sobre todo tiene una deliciosa sazón para la preparación de platillos, pero el platillo que más le gusta son los “Tallarines Verdes”.

Gracias a ese don que ella tiene en la preparación de platos, tiene su negocio de venta de comida, se levanta muy temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar y luego se dirige al mercado para comprar los insumos para la preparación de los platos, le dedica alrededor de 16 horas al día y puede atender hasta 150 clientes al día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene una buena sazón y porque atiende a los clientes como si fueran de su familia por ello siempre regresan a su negocio y la recomiendan.

Celia agradece mucho a los prestatarios kiva porque con la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mantenimiento y reparación a su cocina, la cual es su herramienta más importante, con esta mejora no tendrá problemas cuando prepare las comidas y preparar los platillos de manera más rápida y sus clientes no tendrán que esperan mucho, con ello tendrá mejores ingresos para seguir luchando y cumplir su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y mejorar su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Celia is a very tenacious woman.  She is married and has a 13-year-old son who is in the second year of his secondary education.  Her husband is always by her side, supporting her in everything, in spite of the fact that he has a job carrying out maintenance work on the South Panamerican Highway.  He always takes time to encourage her and help her.  Celia is very creative and, above all, she gives the dishes that she prepares delicious seasoning. The dish that she enjoys most is 'Tallerines Verdes' (green noodles). 

Thanks to the gift that Celia has for making food, she has a food sales business.  She gets up very early in the morning to do her housework and then she heads to the market to buy the supplies that she needs to prepare her dishes.  She works around 16 hours a day and can serve up to 150 customers a day.  She believes that her business is doing well because her food has good seasoning and because she serves her customers as if they were her family.  For this reason, they always return to her business and recommend her.

Celia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, with the help that they give her, she will be able to repair and service her stove, which is her most important tool.  This improvement will mean that she will not experience problems when she makes her meals.  She will be able to prepare her dishes more quickly and her customers won't have to wait so much.  This will make her better income so that she can continue working hard and fulfill her biggest dream: "To give my son a profession and improve my home".

loans.use: to repair and service her stove

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Monsieur  DAOUDA est né vers 1955 à Fabalabougou dans l’ex arrondissement de Niena. Polygame et père de huit enfants, il réside avec ses deux femmes et leurs enfants à Niena, situé à environs 80 km de la ville de Sikasso.
 Monsieur DAOUDA, après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage et commercialisation de  céréales (mil, maïs, riz, etc.), il y a environ 30 ans. Nanti d’une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes de l’extérieur, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il décide d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso cette année. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Daouda sollicite ce prêt, qui lui permettra d’acheter, 17 sacs de mil et 10 maïs. 
Il s’approvisionne dans les village de: Fabalabougou et de Niena. Les céréales ainsi achetées sont stockées dans son  magasin. Ses ventes se font en gros, en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.    
 Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA par mois. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Daouda was born around 1955 in Fabalabougou, former district of Niena.  He lives in a polygamous family, with his two wives and eight children, in Niena, about 80 kilometers from the town of Sikasso.  
After conducting several activities without much success, he quickly learned the business of storing and selling grains (millet, maize, rice etc.) about 30 years ago.  Having acquired a very good experience in this field, he enjoys a good reputation and receives numerous orders from outside, but he lacks the resources to meet his customers' needs.  This is why he has decided to join Soro Yiriwaso this year.  In order to better satisfy an ever-increasing number of customers, Daouda has requested the present loan, which will allow him to buy 17 bags of millet and 10 bags of maize.  He gets his supplies in the villages of Fabalabougou and Niena and then stores them in his shop.  He sells wholesale, retail, and for cash, to customers who are either resellers or consumers.  With this loan, he is expecting monthly profits to reach 50,000 CFA francs.  He is planning to use his profits to take care of most of his personal and family expenses and to pay off his loan's interest, while he will invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Alegre y trabajador; así es Julio de 30 años, le gusta salir adelante; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Dionicia de 26 años y su pequeño hijo Maicol de 04 años. Julio, es un hombre de usura le gusta estar en los campos verdes de su chacra rodeado con plantas de cacao que produce, a él le gusta ver que su producción sean de buena calidad; y sabe que siendo así, los centros de acopio le pagan muy bien por cada kilo de cacao. Es por ello que siempre esta al tanto de sus sembríos; lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros, es así que logran terminar extraer rápido los frutos. Con el tiempo desea en abrir una tienda para que su esposa pueda trabajar tranquila y de esa forma ambos se apoyen con los gastos de su hogar. Pero lo que mas prioriza es poder cultivar mas plantas de cacao en sus tierras de producción. Este será su crédito número 08 con MFP, se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual, además, se siente satisfecho con su banco comunal. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de cacao para incrementar en su chacra.
texts.en:
30-year-old Julio is a cheerful and hard-working man who likes to do well in life.  He lives in his own home together with his wife, 26-year-old Dionicia, and his young son Maicol who is 4 years old.  Julio is a man who enjoys being in the green fields of his farm, surrounded by the cacao plants that he produces.  He enjoys seeing that he has good-quality production as he knows that this means the warehouses will pay him very well for every kilo of cacao.  For this reason, he is always caring for his crops.  He has been in this business for 15 years and at harvest time he relies on the support of laborers as they enable him to pick his fruit quickly.  Over time, he would like to open a store so that his wife can work peacefully and they can both support their household expenses.  However, his main priority is growing more cacao plants on his land.

This will be Julio's 8th loan from MFP.  He pledges to make his repayments on time and feels happy to be a member of his community bank.  He will use the 2,000 soles he has requested to buy cacao plants so that he can expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants

loans.name: Teresita De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Teresita es socia del banco comunal Chacaritas, vive en la parroquia de Tarqui  en Cuenca, cuenta con un centro parroquial pequeño conjunto urbano, de traza irregular, con viviendas de adobe, bahareque y techo de teja, que conserva su arquitectura vernácula y tradicional, la iglesia y las vías de acceso que comunican a la parroquia con la ciudad de Cuenca. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y  muchos laboran en la ciudad.

La Señora. Teresita tiene 33 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 16, 14, 13, 9 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo se encuentra estudiando en el colegio y dos de sus hijos están en una escuelita de la localidad. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña Teresita trabaja como empleada de lunes a viernes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cerdos a los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos para continuar con su negocio. 

Su meta es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Teresita is a member of the communal bank Chacaritas. She lives in the Tarqui parish of Cuenca, which has a town center with a small collection of buildings, adobe homes with tile roofs in the traditional and regional architectural style, a church, and roads that connect the parish to the city of Cuenca. Local people work raising animals or farming and many of them work in the city. 

Teresita is 33 years old. She is a single mother with five children of 16, 14, 13, 9 and 4 years of age. Her oldest son works and helps her out economically. Her second son is studying at high school and two of her children are at the local school. The house they live in is her own property.

Teresita works as an employee from Monday to Friday from 6 o'clock in the morning until 6 in the afternoon. At home she raises and looks after pigs which she sells in her community.

This is her 2nd loan with her communal bank and she will invest it in buying pigs to continue with her business.

Her aim is to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Sandra Noemi

texts.es:
La Señorita. Sandra es socia del banco comunal Chacaritas, vive en la parroquia de Tarqui en Cuenca, cuenta con un centro parroquial pequeño conjunto urbano, de traza irregular, con viviendas de adobe, bahareque y techo de teja, que conserva su arquitectura vernácula y tradicional, la iglesia y las vías de acceso que comunican a la parroquia con la ciudad de Cuenca. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad.

La Señorita. Sandra tiene 20 años, es madre soltera de un niño de año y seis meses, vive con su madre quien se dedica a cuidar una hacienda y ahí mismo viven.

Ella al igual que su mamá trabajan en la hacienda, esta actividad la desempeña hace un año y trabaja de lunes a viernes. También cría cuyes a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.

Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en víveres ya que va a iniciar un negocio de venta de comida.
  
Su sueño es tener un taller de costura.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the Chacaritas community bank. She lives in Tarqui parish in Cuenca, which has a town center with a small collection of buildings, adobe homes with tile roofs in the traditional, local architectural style, a church, and roads that connect the parish to Cuenca. People work raising animals, farming or have jobs in the city. 

Sandra is 20 years old and she is a single mother of a 1 and a half year old boy. She lives with her mother who takes care of a farm and that is where they live. Sandra has also worked on the farm for the last year, from Monday to Friday. She also raises guinea pigs and sells them in order to make extra money. 

This is her third loan from the community bank and she will use it to buy ingredients in order to open her own business selling food. Her dream is to have her own sewing shop.

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Mijeres De Chilcatotoras (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Chilcatotoras está formado por 13 socias quienes laboran en diferentes actividades  principalmente en el campo, tanto en la cría de animales como en la agricultura. Son personas amables, gentiles y de un gran carisma. Viven por la parroquia de Tarqui en Cuenca, cuenta con un centro parroquial pequeño conjunto urbano, de traza irregular, con viviendas de adobe, bahareque y techo de teja, que conserva su arquitectura vernácula y tradicional, la iglesia y las vías de acceso que comunican a la parroquia con la ciudad de Cuenca. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Rosa, tiene 47 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos de 28, 23, 22, 19, 16, 14 y 10 años de edad, sus cuatro hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su cuarto hijo es especial por lo que pasa en casa, su penúltimo hijo pasa en casa y le ayuda con los quehaceres del hogar y su ultima hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de uno de sus hijos.
 
Doña María Rosa se dedica a la cría de ganado, gallinas, cuyes y conejos a los que los vende en su comunidad, también labora en la agricultura y sus cosechas son solo para el consumo de su hogar.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos.
 
Su meta es tener un una granja agrícola.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Chilcatotoras communal bank is made up of 13 members who work in different activities, mainly in the country, both raising animals and farming. They are kind, polite people with a lot of charisma. They live in the parish of Tarqui in Cuenca. It has a small urban parish center with an irregular  shape and houses made of adobe, waddle and daub and thatched roofs. It retains is specific and traditional architecture, its church and the access roads that connect the parish to the city of Cuenca.    

One of the members of this group is María Rosa. She is 47 years old, a widow and the mother of 7 children, aged 28, 23, 22, 19, 16, 14 and 10 years old. Four of her children work and help her financially. Her fourth child is special, so he stays at home. Her second youngest is at home and helps with the housework and her youngest daughter goes to a school in the community. She doesn't own her own home and lives in one of her children's houses.
 
María Rosa raises cattle, chickens, guinea pigs and rabbits, which she sells in her community. She also farms and her harvests are just for her household consumption.
 
She has been in the communal bank for two years and will invest the new loan in buying chickens.
 
Her goal is to have a farm.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Asunción De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Asunción de la Concepción  es  soltera y se dedica a la actividad de ventas de platanitos, yuquitas fritas actividad que se dedica hace 27 años el cual inició con un capital de C$500.00 producto de sus ahorros. Empieza su actividad comercial desde las 5 de la mañana haciendo las compras de plátanos y yuca en mercado la terminal posteriormente se traslada a su casa de habitación para la elaboración y empaque de sus productos, las que entregara a diferentes colegios, universidades, y comerciante que vende en el mercado la terminal. 

 La señora Asunción utilizara el crédito para la compra de plátanos y yuca que utilizaran para la elaboración de las diferentes frituras, la señora Asunción esta sumamente agradecida con ceprodel por el apoyo brindado con el cual a podido satisfacer la demanda de su clientela e incrementar su capital de trabajo y mejor su sus condiciones de vida tanto para ella como para su familia.
texts.en:
Asunción de la Concepción is single.  Her business is selling plantain chips and fried cassava.  She has been in this business for 27 years.  She started out with 500 cordobas in capital from her savings.  She starts work at 5.00am, buying plantains and cassava in La Terminal market.  She then goes home to make and package her products which she delivers to different high schools and universities, and retailers who sell in La Terminal market.

Asunción will use her loan to buy plantains and cassava which she will use to make her different fried snacks.  She is extremely grateful to Ceprodel for the support that they have given her as it enables her to meet her customer demand, increase her working capital and improve her family's living conditions as well as her own.

loans.use: to buy plantains, cassava, oil, salt, firewood and plastic bags

loans.name: Victor Maximo

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre luchador y sobre todo dedicado, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, por la agricultura y por la generosidad de sus pobladores, en su tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a caminar en especial si tiene alguna preocupación o esta de mal humor, el nos comenta que le ayuda a despejar la mente y pensar mejor las cosas, como buen peruano ama la comida por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo saltado de carne, por los pocos recursos de económicos de sus padres solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado de primaria.

Victor es maestro constructor, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de doce horas diarias, dependiendo del tamaño de la construcción y de los tedioso que esta pueda ser, en un mes puede atender hasta 3 clientes, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque realiza muy bien su trabajado, siempre busca que queden bonitos para que sus clientes se sientan contentos con lo que él hace.

Victor agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar herramientas para su trabajo de construcción, con esta mejora, tendrá herramientas adecuadas para realizar mejor su trabajo y seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño: “Mejorar su calidad de Vida”.
texts.en:
Victor is a fighter and above all a dedicated man. He lives in the city of Camaná, which is known for its beautiful beaches, its agriculture and for the generosity of its residents. In his free time, Victor likes to go for walks, especially if he is worried about something or in a bad mood, because it helps him to clear his mind and think things through more clearly. As a good Peruvian he loves food and his favorite dish is "saltado de carne" or chipped beef. Due to his parents' limited economic resources, Victor was only able to study until the 6th grade. 

Victor is a master builder and he works about 12 hours a day depending on the size of the job and how labor-intensive it is. He serves about 3 customers a month. He thinks his business is going well because he is very good at his work, and because he always tries to make the finished product as beautiful as possible so that his customers are satisfied. 

Victor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support he will be able to buy more tools. Once he has the right tools, he will be able to do his job better and get closer to his dream: to improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: to buy building tools.

loans.name: Ñu Pora Group

texts.es:
Ñu pora está en el Primer Ciclo, con 18 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsable entre ellas, las mismas realizan labores comunitarias y actividades para el comité. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudar a sus familias y a sus hijos.
Eugenia comenta que se dedica a la venta de helados de variadas clases. Dice que le va muy bien puesto que siempre tiene muy buena venta, ya que la mayoría del tiempo aquí hace calor. Por medio de su trabajo ella ha podido ayudar en la casa, y de esa forma mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo, y un día poder tener una gran heladería, donde pueda dar trabajo a otras personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de helados, para que de esa forma pueda seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ñu Pora is in its first cycle and has 18 members. this group stands out in the neighborhood for being very united, supportive and responsible. The members do community work and activities for the committee. They came together with the goal of working together an through this work be able to help their families and their children.

Eugenia says that she sells different types of ice cream. She says that it is going very well for her since she has good sales, since it is hot most of the time here. Through her job, she has been able to help out at home and thus improve her family's condition. Her goal is to keep growing and one day have a great ice cream shop, where she can give jobs to other people. 

She is asking for the loan to buy ice cream, so that she can continue working and meeting her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Domingo Leonel

texts.es:
El señor Domingo es  casado y se dedica a la actividad de ventas frutas y verduras, como plátanos, mandarina, naranjas y otras frutas de la época se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 5 años. Empieza su actividad comercial desde las 4 de la mañana haciendo las compras al por mayor de frutas y verduras en el mercado la terminal directamente a dueños de las cosechas posteriormente se traslada a la terminal de buses para ofrecerle sus productos a su clientela finalizando su actividad laboral a las 3 de la tarde.
Inicio su negocio con un capital de C$ 2,000.00 producto de sus ahorros.

El señor Domingo utilizara el crédito para la compra de plátanos y diferentes frutas de la época, el señor Domingo esta sumamente agradecido con ceprodel por el apoyo brindado ya que ha logrado aumentar  su negocio y la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Domingo is married and makes a living selling fruit and vegetables such as bananas, mandarins, oranges and other seasonal fruit. He has worked in this activity for the past five years. He starts his working day at four o'clock in the morning buying fruit and vegetables wholesale in the market directly from the owners of the harvests. Later he travels to the bus station to offer his products to his loyal customers and finishes work at 3 o'clock in the afternoon.

He started his business with an initial working capital of C$2,000 from his savings.

Domingo will use the loan to buy bananas and other seasonal fruit. Domingo is very grateful to Ceprodel for the support given which has helped him to extend his business and the quality of his products.

loans.use: to buy bananas, yucca, mandarins, oranges, melons.

loans.name: Marjorie De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Marjorie de los Ángeles es propietaria de una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, inicia sus labores a las 6:00 am y las finaliza a las 6:00 pm, realiza tus compras para abastecer su negocio 2 veces por semana en el mercado la terminal.

La señora Marjorie utilizará el crédito brindado para la compra de Arroz, Azúcar, Aceite al por mayor, papel higiénico, jabón, cloro, ace, salsas, sopa maggi, huevos, gaseosas, jugos, pasta dental, etc, y así ha podido mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia.

Este  negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 10,000.00 producto de liquidación de su trabajo anterior de su compañero, actualmente la señora Marjorie trabaja como promotora de ventas dejando a su compañero de vida a cargo del negocio.

Gracias a los créditos brindados por CEPRODEL ha logrado incrementar el inventario de su negocio con productos de mejor calidad y mejor la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marjorie de los Ángeles is the owner of a grocery store which is located in her home.  She starts work at 6.00am and finishes at 6.00pm.  She buys stock for her business twice a week in La Terminal market.

Marjorie will use her loan to buy rice, sugar and oil wholesale, toilet paper, soap, bleach, Ace, sauces, Maggi soups, eggs, soda, juice, toothpaste, etc.  She has been able to improve her own standard of living as well as that of her family.

Marjorie started this business with 10,000 cordobas in capital which was her partner's severance pay from his previous job.  Marjorie currently works as a sales promoter, leaving her life partner in charge of the business.

Thanks to her loans from CEPRODEL, Marjorie has managed to increase the inventory of her business with better-quality products.  She has also been able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and oil wholesale, toilet paper, soap, bleach, Ace, sauces, Maggi soups, eggs, soda, juice, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy costumes and lights.

loans.name: Haratta

texts.en:
Haratta is 27 years old and lives in Airport community (the town near Robert International Air port).  She is single and she stopped her education in the eleventh grade.  

For the past twelve years, she has been selling dry fish in the local market.  She likes her business because it makes her independent.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry fish (butter nose fish and cassava fish) for her business.  She learned this way of selling from her mother.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Tity

texts.en:
This is 42 year old Tity.  She is married and has 4 children ages 20,18, 7 and 3 years old.  In 2008 Tity established her charcoal business.  She began her business because she wants to assist her husband in taking care of the home. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,800,000 every month from this business.  She would like a loan of SLL 4,000,000. She needs this new loan in order to buy bags of charcoal.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000.  In the future, Tity plans to educate her children up to university level.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca lives in Airport Community. She is 49 years old and married with five children, between 18 and 31 years old. For the past 20 years, Rebecca has been selling charcoal in her community. Rebecca says she spends most of her time with her business since her business helps to sustain the family. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Yassa

texts.en:
Yassah lives in Airport community. She is married and has six children aged 2 to 14 years old. 

For the past two years she been selling charcoal in her community. She likes how people respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase  more charcoal for her business. She plans to buy herself some land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 40 years old.  She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school.  She has a business, selling fish in Yambio, South Sudan.  She has been in business for five years.

Angelina is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use any extra income generated from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old.  She is married and has seven children, three of whom attend school.   She has a business, selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan.  She has been in business for three months.

Josephine is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use any extra income generated from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 43 years old.  She is married and has one child who attends school.  She has a business, selling fish in Yambio, South Sudan.  She has been in business for six years.

Alice is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use any extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fee.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe BENKADI  sont essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à  NIENA.
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
SANATA fait le commerce de friperie dans ce groupe de femmes de  BENKADI, elle se tient au milieu en position assise.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  une balle de friperie à BAMAKO.
 Elle les revend au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The seven members of Benkadi Group are mostly married women, who average 34 years of age and three children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Niena.

They are seeking their fourth loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

Sanata is a member of the group who sells secondhand clothing. In the photograph, she's the one sitting in the middle.

She intends to use her part of the loan to buy one bale of secondhand clothing in Bamako. She resells for cash at the market and at her home, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 15'000 (ca US$ 30), to be used in part to repay the loan and its interests, and in part for her savings.

She ambitions to bolster her revenue in order to better satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: to buy one bale of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe  FOTEMOGOBAN sont  essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans,  en moyenne  3 enfants et qui vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à  NIENA, région de Sikasso (3ème  région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
MAMOU fait le commerce de COLA dans ce groupe, elle se tient en première position à partir de la droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt ½ panier de cola à Niena ville.
 Elle les revend au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17 500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of Fotemogoban Group are mostly married women, who average 31 years of age and three children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Niena, Sikasso Region (third administrative region of Mali).

They are seeking their fourth loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customers' needs. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

Mamou (fist one from the right in the photograph) sells kola.  She intends to use her part of the loan to buy half a basket of kola in Niena.

She resells it for cash, at the market and at her home, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 17'500 (ca US$ 35), to be used in part to repay the loan and its interests, and in part for her savings.

loans.use: to buy kola

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe  BENKELEMA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à  NIENA. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés
AWA fait le commerce de sucre dans ce groupe,  elle se tient au milieu en position debout.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  3 sacs de sucre à Bamako.
 Elle les revend au  grand marché de NIENA à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle diverse et variée, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22 500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The 6 members of the Benkelema group are married women with an average age of 32 and, on average, 3 children. They live in monogamous families in the town of Niena. This is their 5th loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, requested so that the group's members can satisfy the needs of their clientèle. They have properly repaid their previous loans.

Awa, standing in the middle of the picture, sells sugar. She plans to use her part of the loan to buy 3 bags of sugar in the town of Bamako. She and her family resell the sugar from a fixed spot at the Niena Grand Market to a diverse and varied clientèle, for cash. She anticipates earning an average monthly profit of 22 500 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest, and part of which will be saved. Her goal is to improve her sales revenues so that she is better able to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 27 años de edad, es casado desde hace 9 años, su esposa es ama de casa, tiene 4 hijos de 8, 7,3 y 1 año de edad de los cuales los dos mayores ya estudian, vive con su familia en la aldea de Chiligatoro, Intibucá.
Andrés desde siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de papa, maíz y frijol. Su actividad económica es la venta de papa fresca la cual vende en el mercado local hace 10 años y también es utilizada para su propio consumo. Este producto le ha sido de mayor rentabilidad en el mercado ya que de allí ha podido obtener los recursos necesarios para su familia. Trabajando  todo el día en sus cultivos. 
El ha obtenido 4 créditos con ODEF, los cuales ha invertido en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos.  Actualmente solicita su quinto préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para la compra de semilla de papa, fertilizante e insumos. 
Su plan es poder crecer su área de cultivo y tener mejores fuentes de ingresos en el futuro para darles la educación necesaria a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Andrés, age 27, has been married for nine years.  His wife is a housewife, and he has four children, ages 8, 7, 3, and 1.  The two older ones go to school.  He lives with his family in the Chiligatoro village, Intibucá.

Amdrés has always been a farmer.  He grows potatoes, corn, and beans.  His business activity is selling fresh potatoes at the local market.  He has been doing this for ten years.  The potatoes are also used for his own consumption.  This product has been very profitable for him in the market.  This is where he has been able to get the resources that his family needs.  He works all day on his crops.

He is currently requesting his fifth loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy potato seeds, fertilizers, and supplies.  His plan is to be able to increase the area that he cultivates.  He plans to have better sources of income in the future in order to give his children the necessary education.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, fertilizers, and supplies for his crops.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
DANAYA  est un regroupement de six femmes essentiellement mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  NIENA, région de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés 
MARATOU fait  de la restauration dans ce groupe de femmes de  DANAYA,  elle se tient en troisième position à partir de la gauche.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  2 sacs de riz décortiqué, 40 litres d’huile, 3 cartons de cube magie, 5 boites de concentrée de tomate au marché de Niena ville.
 Elle vend dans sa gargote au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of 6 women, mostly married, with an average age of 35, and, on average, 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in the village of Niena, in the Sikasso region. This is the group's 10th loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, requested so that the group members can satisfy their customers´ needs. They have correctly repaid their previous loans.

Maratou, 3rd from the left in the picture, is in the restauration business. She plans to use her part of the loan to buy 2 bags of shelled rice, 40 litres of oil, 3 boxes of stock cubes and 5 boxes of concentrated tomato paste from the market in Niena. She sells meals in her cheap restaurant located at the market, to a clientèle of men and women, for cash. She anticipates making an average monthly profit of 37 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest, and part of which will be saved.

loans.use: buy ingredients needed for her restauration business.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah, aged 36 years, is a married man living in a semi permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer who has been in this business for five years. He dreams of building a permanent residential house and educating his children. He wants a loan to clear land for crop growing.

loans.use: to clear land for crop growing.

loans.name: Jiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe  JIGUISEME  sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et  en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à NIENA,  dans la région de Sikasso (3ème  région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés
LALA, deuxième à partir de la droite,  fait la vente de condiment dans ce groupe.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 10 carton de cube magi,  20 litres d’huile de palme, 5 paniers de d’oignon, 10 boite de concentrée de tomate au marché de Niena ville. 
 Elle effectue ses vente au marché de Fincolosoba à une clientèle composée principalement de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The 5 members of the Jiguiseme group are married women with an average age of 34 and, on average, 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in the village of Niena, in the region of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). This is the group´s 10th loan request, made by the members in order to be able to satisfy their customers' needs. They have fully repaid their previous loans.

Lala, second from the right in the picture, sells condiments. She plans to use her part of the loan to buy 10 boxes of "Maggi" stock cubes, 20 litres of palm oil, 5 baskets of onions and 10 boxes of concentrated tomato paste from the market in Niena. She resells her merchandise at the market of Fincolosob to a clientèle composed mainly of women, for cash. She envisages earning an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs, some of which she will use to repay the loan and interest, some of which will be saved. She aims to increase her sales revenues so that she is better able to satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Vastina

texts.en: Vastina is a forty-nine-year-old hardworking woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. She has been a farmer for the last thirty years and her major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather. However, she has a vision of buying land to grow crops and hiring employees to help expand her farm. Vastina needs the loan to pay workers who are harvesting maize and mulching her banana plantation.

loans.use: to pay workers who are harvesting maize and mulching her banana plantation..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment like amplifiers and speakers for the mobile disco sound.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen wants to borrow a loan to purchase cooking oil, sugar and cosmetics for resale. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is aged 42 and takes care of his  children and wife. Inadequate capital, high fuel and transportation costs are his business challenges. He desires to educate his children and diversify his business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar and cosmetics.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth used the previous loan to pay school fees for her child. However, she faces a challenge of price fluctuations, inflation, and seasonal weather. She maintains her dream of educating her children and buying land to grow more crops. Elizabeth needs the loan to pay workers who are tilling her garden.

loans.use: to pay workers who are tilling her garden.

loans.name: Chourn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chourn, age 55, operates a fish-selling business from the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Most of her fish are caught from the river by her husband. However, she has to buy more fish in bulk from her frequent suppliers or other local fishermen as well. 

Mrs. Chourn has seven children. Three among them are already married, while the other four live together with their mother in the same house. 

Since her husband's fishing materials were ruined, the income from her business has also decreased. To sustain this revenue, Mrs. Chourn decided to pursue funds from HKL to purchase new fishing materials, including a boat. 

This loan will upgrade Mrs. Chourn's standard of living. She hopes to gain a greater quality of life as she strives to work harder.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing materials, including a boat.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie would like to borrow PHP 24,000 to fund her tailoring business. The tailoring business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide Margie and her family with income that is improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 40 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Regina is in the agricultural business. She raises livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to raise and sell.

Regina has been raising livestock for 13 years now, and she has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Azima

texts.fr:
Azima est une femme  âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un militaire.  Elle a 03enfants dont 01 scolarisé. L’ainé a 22ans et le dernier 02ans.
Azima travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois, de bois de chauffe et du maïs depuis 2002. Elle vend seule à la maison à ses clients et n' éprouve aucune difficulté. Azima a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises.  Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité
Dans les prochaines années, Azima voudrait faire prospérer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Azima is 35 years old and married to a serviceman. She has 3 children aged between 2 and 22, one of whom goes to school. Azima has been selling charcoal, firewood and corn since 2002. She sells the goods to her clients from her home unassisted, and experiences no difficulties.

Azima has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to restock on merchandise. She wants to reinvest in her business and, in the coming years, would like to make her business prosper. She plans to use the profits to help her family blossom.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Philis

texts.en: Philis is 33 years old and is married with two children. She sells used sweaters, bags, and shoes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 7 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy used sweaters, bags, and shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy used sweaters, bags, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 31 years old. He sells toilet papers and belts to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy toilet papers and belts to sell.

loans.use: To buy toilet papers and belts to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is single and has a general store in the Philippines.

Teresita has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

Teresita has been in this business for 35 years now, and she also earns additional income from farming rice.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita would like to borrow PHP 15,000 to fund her sari-sari (general store) business. The business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Moses Mungai

texts.en:
Moses is a very happy man, because his business is doing well. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time.

Moses has been selling clothes for the past three years, and he has applied for a fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more new clothes to add on the stock for sale so that he can meet the demand of his customers.

He hopes to expand his transport business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes to add on the stock for sale so that he can meet the demand of his customers.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Amadou  âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de famille est un transporteur de calèche de profession depuis 18 ans. Et c’est avec les recettes de son activité qu’il arrive à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.  Il vend parallèlement des chevaux  et c’est d’ailleurs ce projet qui motive sa demande de prêt de cinq cent mille francs (500000fcfa) au niveau du guichet. Il faut noter  qu’il est à sa troisième expérience dans le crédit et qu’il a su tirer profil de ses opérations financières.
Amadou aimerai dans l’avenir  construire un abri pour ces bêtes  afin de faciliter l’accès  et les transactions.
texts.en:
Amadou is 39 years old, married and a father. He has been a calèche (horse-drawn carriage) driver for 18 years. The income from his business enables him to satisfy his family´s needs. He also has a sideline business selling horses, and it is for this enterprise that he is requesting a five hundred thousand franc (500 000 FCFA) loan from the UIMCEC branch.

Amadou is currently on his 3rd loan and has been able to make a profit from his financial activities. He would eventually like to be able to build a shelter for the animals, in order to facilitate access and business transactions.

loans.use: to buy horses for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 43 years old. She is from Nakuru. She is married to Christopher, and they have three children between the ages of 5 and 18 years old.

Judith has a food canteen that she has been running for the past four years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD, to enable her buy cooking fat, rice, sugar, and other ingredients to add to her stock.

She hopes to own a big hotel [restaurant] in the near future.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a thirty eight-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of four children. She rears pigs in Kiambu. Beatrice has been in the business for six years now and gets a monthly income of five thousand shillings.

This will be Beatrice’s second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more piglets and buy fertilizer for her tea farm. 

With the profit that she will get, she wants to use it to buy more piglets for rearing. In the future, she wants to expand on her farming to rear dairy cows to increase more income.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 33-year-old lady from Kisumu city. She is married with four children, and the family has one additional orphaned child under their care.

Judith operates a fish-selling business, she has been in this business for the last 13 years, making a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy fish stocks to sell. She will use profits to educate her children. Her dream is to buy land and build a family house.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 35-year-old lady from Kisumu City, Western Kenya. She is married to Barack, and blessed with three  children aged between seven to 16 years.

For the last 13 years, Janet has operated a grocery stall, making a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy tomatoes, onions, fruits, and other foodstuffs. Her profits will be used to expand her business.

Her dream is to have a big business where she can supply commodities wholesale.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a 42-year-old lady from Kisumu city. She is married to Isaac, and they have four children between the ages of 12 and 21 years.

For the last 10 years, Maureen has operated a fish-selling business in Kisumu. She is taking her first loan, which she will use to buy fresh fish to sell. She will use her profits to expand her business.

Her dream is to have a big fish-selling business in Kisumu.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
