The new motorbike will run more smoothly and allow him to attract more customers and generate more income to support his family. In the future, he would like to buy a piece of farmland where he can grow crops and earn more income to provide his family with a better life. His goals are to support his children's schooling so they can all get a Bachelor's degree, and rebuild his house so that it will be stronger and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and four children. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by running a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more of these items to sell to her customers. Melinda is  a new member of HSPFI and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 42 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de Juan, su esposo desde hace 23 años. Juntos tienen 6 hijos, de los cuales vive con 5 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Jatumpampa. La siembra de diversos tubérculos es su principal actividad económica. Cuenta con sembríos de papa, maíz, olluco y alverja. Ya tienen 20 años dedicándose a esto, su amplia experiencia le ayudaron a ahorrar lo necesario para comprarse sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Pero confiesa que le faltan parcelas para sus sembríos por eso en cada campaña, alquila algunas tierras y de esa manera abastece su producción. L e gusta mucho su trabajo, eso le hace sentirse vive y muy tranquila sobre todo en estos momentos en los que se encuentra atravesando por problemas muy fuertes. Pero no se desanima, sabe que la vida continúa y quiere triunfar por sus hijos. En cada cosecha comercializa sus alimentos a la capital del país, pero hay ocasiones en los que los mismo comerciantes llegan a sus cultivos para comprar las cosechas integras. Por otro lado cría animales como ovejas que vende cuando necesita y a veces para su consumo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Jatumpampa al progreso” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde está feliz de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
María de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos entre sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
42-year-old María is a modest woman.  She lives together with Juan, her husband of 23 years.  The couple have six children, five of whom still live with them in their own home, in the town of Jatumpampa.  María's main business activity is sowing tubers.  She grows potatoes, corn, olluco (a native tuber) and peas.  She has been working in this business for 20 years and her vast experience has helped her to save up the money she needed to buy her own farmland.  However, she admits that she needs still more plots of land for her crops and so every year she hires land and thereby enables her production.  María very much enjoys her work.  It makes her feel alive and very peaceful, above all right now when she is experiencing some very bad problems.  However, she does not become discouraged, she knows that life goes on and she would like to do well for her children's sake.  Every harvest time, María sells her crops in the country's capital.  However, sometimes the buyers come to her and buy her entire harvest.  In addition, María also raises animals such as sheep which she sells when the need arises and sometimes uses for her own consumption.  

Maria belongs to the 'Jatumpampa al Progreso' community bank and this is her fourth loan from MFP.  She is happy to know that she will have financial support to make progress in her business.  For her part, she pledges, once again, to make her repayments on time.  She enjoys belonging to her community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Maria will invest the money she requested in buying natural fertilizers which she will spread over her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is a married woman. She has two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. Mwanaisha operates a business selling lesos (also known as kanga, these are articles of clothing) from her home. She's worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are her neighbors and the local area women. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality. Her highest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and rent. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Mwanaisha will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more lesos for resale. Mwanaisha aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more lesos for resale.

loans.name: Bros

texts.en: Bros, 24, is married and resides with his wife and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a garment worker for more than six years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. His wife is also a garment worker and earns approximately 3 USD per day. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Bros is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. By doing so, he would save some money on his transportation expense for the family. In the future, he would like to run an animal husbandry business in order to generate more income for the family. Moreover, he hopes to rebuild his present house to make it much stronger and send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Nancy has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Nancy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Rim

texts.en: Rim, 43, is widowed and resides with a son and a nephew in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been selling fruits for more than five years, earning approximately 4 USD per day. Her son is a garment worker and earns approximately 3 USD per day. In order to generate more income for the family, Rim is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a generator that she will rent out. In the future, she would like to expand her business by renting a store for selling her fruits. She also would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger in order to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a generator

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is 43 years old, married and a mother of five children, ages 20, 18, 14, 12, and 9. She sells cereals, a business she ventured into ten years ago. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy bags of maize and beans to add to her inventory for sale. Her profit will help her repay her loan. Her dreams are to expand her business. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and beans

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina de 46 años de edad convive con macedonio de 46 años fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el mismo distrito de Pichari. Generosa y trabajadora así es Valentina, desde muy pequeña trabajo en la agricultura cultivando cacao, café, plátano y cítricos. Ya de joven viajó a la ciudad de lima con la finalidad de buscar mejores condiciones de vida en donde conoció a su esposo. Poco tiempo después las cosas se pusieron inestables por el mal momento que pasaba el país y decidieron volver a Pichari en donde ahora se dedican ambos al cultivo del cacao y café que son productos que tienen una demanda considerable en el mercado exterior.
Valentina está contenta con esta labor que realiza por que le genera una rentabilidad optima. En un futuro ella esta pensando seguir instalando más plantaciones de cacao con la finalidad de obtener mejores cosechas y mayores ingresos. Este es su segundo crédito, con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Ella está contenta con su banco comunal por que son puntuales y solidarios. Con los 3,500 ella invertirá en la compra de plantas de cacao con la finalidad de incrementar su campo agricola.
texts.en:
Valentina, 46, lives with Macedonio, 46, and they have 3 children. They live together in their own house in the District of Pichari. Valentina is generous and hard-working. She’s been working in agriculture since she was very little, cultivating cocoa, coffee, bananas and citrus. When she was young, she’s travelled to Lima with the purpose of finding better living conditions, and there she met her husband. Soon after, things went badly in Lima because the country was going through political instability, so they decided to move back to Pichari. In Pichari, they began cultivating cocoa and coffee and both products are in considerable demand in the outside market.

Valentina is happy with her line of work because it generates an optimal return. In the future, she is thinking about cultivating more cocoa plantations in order to obtain better crops and better income. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she promises to pay it off punctually. She is happy with the communal bank because they’re punctual and supportive. With the loan, she would invest in the purchase of cocoa plants with the purpose of increasing her crops.

loans.use: buy cocoa plants.

loans.name: Ngo

texts.en:
Ngo is 59 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are employed. She lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been producing brooms to sell for over 10 years and are successful in their career. They earn approximately $3 per day.  

In order to improve her business, Ngo is requesting a loan for $800 to purchase a motorbike for carrying brooms to sell. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and support her children to study until they earn a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for carrying brooms to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has five children who attend school. She operates a food stall and sells her goods at the market. She has worked in this business for six years. Her primary customers are the local area residents. 

Fatuma is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase more stocks of beans, wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil for her business. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality; her highest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and rent. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Fatuma aspires to establish a hotel in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Ort

texts.en:
Ort is married and has two children who are employed. She lives in Baray district of Kompong Tom, where agricultural businesses are common.  Ort operates a fish-selling business in a local market of the province. Her husband cultivates rice and he fishes. Together, this couple is able to earn approximately $4.00 per day to cover their daily expenses. 

Ort is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for her two children to commute to their workplaces. In the future, she. aims to drive her family-owned businesses towards success.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura de 20 años  vive en Soledad y se dedica al comercio, actividad que inició desde el año 2009 ayudando a su padre en su negocio, del cual tomó toda su experiencia, aprendiendo desde lo básico hasta lo técnico en términos de ventas; con un pequeño capital se independizó e inició contacto con los diferentes conductores de rutas de buses de la ciudad a quienes ofreció productos para vehículos, como farolas, parasoles pellones, foros para timón etc. Con su negoció le ha ido muy bien ella vende a crédito y tiene 2 locales comerciales ubicados en 2 terminales  de buses de la ciudad, donde vende  de contado. Su meta mas adelante es extender su infraestructura hacia todas las terminales de buses de la ciudad, por eso se esfuerza trabajando persistentemente para lograrlo en un futuro, lo que es su máximo desafío. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará artículos de lujos para vehículos, como farolas, stop, cornetas, parasoles, cintas led, cajas de monedas, pellones, forros para timón, lo que planea comprar al por mayor para obtener mejores descuentos y generar mas utilidades, porque ante la creciente demanda de estos artículos su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para lograrlo. .
texts.en:
Laura is 20 years old and lives in Soledad. She makes a living working in sales, which she has been doing since 2009 when she began helping her father in his business. By working with him she gained all her experience. She has learned everything from the basic to the technical in terms of sales. With a small amount of capital she started a small business independently, by contacting different bus drivers on the city route and offering them products for their vehicles like headlights, sun shades and seat and steering wheel covers, etc.

Her business has done very well. She sells on credit and has two commercial locations, located in two different bus terminals in the city, where she sells her goods. Her goal for the future is to expand her business to be able to sell in all of the bus terminals in the city. She is working hard to be able to accomplish this in the future and achieve her biggest goal.    

She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, which is her first loan that she has taken out through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy car accessories like: headlights, brake lights, horns, sun shades, LED lights, coin boxes and seat and steering wheel covers, which she plans to buy in bulk to get a better discount and have better profits. With the growing demand for these items, the working capital she has is not sufficient.

loans.use: to buy car accessories in bulk, like: headlights, brake lights, horns, sun shades, LED lights, coin boxes and seat and steering wheel covers.

loans.name: Los Rosales Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Luque está integrado por mujeres que ya habían formado parte de otro grupo y por eso invitaron a sus amigas y vecinas y de allí surge el grupo llamado los rosales. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que se esfuerzan para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa.
La Sra. Lucina es una de las integrantes, ella es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 41 años,tiene 2 hijos, esta casada con el Sr Wilfrido quien es constructor de obras. Ambos trabajan arduamente para poder ayudar a sus hijos, pues de esa forma podrán salir adelante y tener un mejor futuro. Lucina se dedica a la venta de comestibles, en lo cual le va muy bien, es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de panificados, verduras, carnes y demás insumos para continuar en la venta de sus comestibles.
Agradece a kiva y a fundación paraguaya por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group, from the city of Luque, is made up of women who were already part of another group and invited their friends and neighbours to form this group: "Los Rosales". They are very hard-working and enterprising women who work hard to give their families everything they need for a dignified and respectable life.
Mrs. Lucina is one of the group members; she is the group president. She is 41, has two children, and is married to Mr. Wilfrido, who works in construction. They both work very hard to support their children so that they can get ahead and have a better future. Lucina sells food, and her business is going very well. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of baked goods, vegetables, meat, and other items so that she can continue to sell food.
She thanks Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, vegetables, meat, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Elias Stalin

texts.es:
Stalin es un hombre de 42 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su taller mecánico

Su historia comenzó cuando el trabajaba para una empresa y decidió independizarse ya que no le alcanzaba lo que ganaba ahora es muy conocido en su sector y tiene algunos clientes, su trabajo lo hace solo cuando tiene varios carros para arreglar llama a un ayudante, no tiene dificultades, no esta casado, no tiene hijos.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia porque vive con su madre. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su taller mecánico y poder comprar herramientas para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Stalin, 42, has many aspirations for his repair shop business to prosper in the next few years.

His story starts when he was an employee at a company and decided to become independent since he was barely making a living. Now he’s very well known in his business and has a few clients. He works alone, but when he has many cars to repair, he hires an assistant. He hasn’t any difficulties. He’s single and has no children.

His dream is to own his own house, as he currently lives with his mother. He is requesting a loan for his repair shop, to invest in tools in order to improve the service to his clients.

loans.use: buy tools.

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Monsieur Matar  est un jeune homme de 31 ans qui vit dans l’une des localités villageoises du Sénégal.  Il s’active pleinement dans le secteur de l’aviculture et capitalise une expérience de 10 ans dans son activité. Il a choisi son activité par amour et passion. Il éprouve beaucoup de plaisir   a voir évoluer ses poussins, leur croissance et les bénéfices réalisés l’intéressent  beaucoup. Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEc depuis 2004. Il sollicite un crédit de 350 000 frs prévu pour  l’agrandissement de son activité.  Son crédit antérieur lui a permis d’acheter un réfrigérateur . Son objectif futur est d’élargir le maximum son poulailler.
texts.en:
Matar is thirty-one years old, and lives in a village in Senegal. He works hard in the agriculture sector and has 10 years of experience. He chose this line of work because he is passionate about it. Matar is very happy to watch his chicks change as they grow, and he likes the amount of profit he makes. 

Matar has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since 2004. He is asking for a loan of 350,000 francs to expand his business. With his previous loan, he was able to buy a refrigerator. His goal for the future is to expand his hen house to the maximum.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to expand his activity.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 53 years old and married with three children. He distributes water to earn a living. He has been in the business for 2 years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy an electric water pump.

loans.use: to buy an electric water pump

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es: Rosalinda de 41 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive junto a Víctor, su esposo desde hace 23 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 4 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Ahuaycha. Posee varias casas, “el trabajo duro”, es su lema. Por ello no descansa y realiza varias actividades que la ayudan a progresar. En la mañana realiza panes, en un horno artesanal que fabricó. Tiene un panadero que les ayuda. Con el auto que poseen su esposo traslada el pan a diversos caseríos y anexos de la zona. Asimismo tiene un ómnibus con el que realizan trasporte público en las rutas Acraquia – Pillo, dos anexos concurridos por su actividad económica, ahí contrata un chofer que junto a su hijo administran las ganancias, les va muy bien sobre todo porque no existe mucha competencia. Durante el día su nuera, se dedica al cuidado de su tienda de comestibles que puso en su casa, donde vende alimentos de primera necesidad. Además de los animales que cría, tiene gallinas de corral, grandes y saludables que comercializa en cualquier eventualidad, asimismo 100 cerdos que los distribuye en diversas casas pequeñas, separadas por adobe de acuerdo a la edad y al sexo, después de engordarlos los comercializa como carne cocinada llamada “lechón” , que es muy consumida en la zona. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde está feliz de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Rosalinda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar el monto para comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Rosalinda, 41, is a very hard worker. She lives with Victor, her husband of 23 years. They both have 8 children, but only live with 4 of them in their own house located in the annex of Ahuaycha. She owns various houses. Her motto is “hard work”, so she doesn’t rest. She has several lines of work that help her get ahead. In the morning, she bakes bread in the artisanal oven she built. She has a baker who helps them. With their car, her husband transports the bread to various townships in the area. They also own an omnibus that provides public transportation on the Acraquia-Pillo route, two townships that are well-travelled for economic reasons. They hired a driver from that area who administers the earnings with his son. That business does very well because there is almost no competition.

During the day, her daughter-in-law tends to the grocery store that they have in their house and where they sell everyday items. As well as the animals that they breed, they have big and healthy corral chickens that they sell at every possibility. They also have 100 pigs that they distribute in diverse small houses, separated by adobe according to age and sex; after fattening them up, they cook the meat and sell it as “lechon” (suckling), a food that is consumed in this area. 

This is the 4th loan from MFP, where she is happy to receive the financial support to get ahead with her business. She promises to meet her payments. Also, she’s happy to be a part of this association because all of the members are responsible and supportive. With the loan, Rosalinda will invest in the purchase of a house.

loans.use: buy a house.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar, trabaja en el área de salud como fisioterapeuta en una entidad publica de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar su tesis en la universidad y de esta forma tener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Omar, es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Omar works in the healthcare arena as a physical therapist for a public entity in La Paz city.

He is requesting the loan to pay for his university thesis, and in this way to earn more income to support his family.

Omar is single with no children.  He lives in his parents' home in the Tembladerani neighborhood of La Paz city.

This is his first time working with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of preparing his thesis for his university degree.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma would like to borrow PHP 22,000 to fund her recycling business. The recycling business that she previously funded through NWTF continues to provide her the opportunity to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal and plastic for her recycling business.

loans.name: Maricela Magdalena

texts.es:
Maricela es una mujer de 25 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta ambulante de productos faciales.

Su historia comenzó apenas cumplí la mayoría de edad debía yo tener sus propios ingresos, entonces penso en poner su negocio de venta de productos por catálogos, terapia y masajes gracias a mis conocimientos, trabaja sola y pongo en prácticas mis conocimientos todos los días, sus dificultades son los ladrones y el transporte, esta soltera y no piensa en casarse, no tiene hijos

Su sueño es tener un local de venta de productos por catalogo y ser directora de catalogo. Quiere el préstamo para su venta ambulante de productos y maquinas para su local de masajes.
texts.en:
Maricela is a 25-year-old woman who has many aspirations for helping her business to prosper over the coming years.  Her business is selling facial products as an itinerant vendor.

Maricela's business story began when she had just barely come of age.  She needed to make her own income and so decided to set up a business selling catalog products and offering therapy and massages, owing to her knowledge in this area.  She works alone and puts her knowledge into practice every day.  The difficulties she faces are thieves and transport.  She is single and isn't thinking about getting married.  She doesn't have any children.

Maricela's dream is to have a sales location for her catalog products and to become a catalog manager.  She would like this loan for her sales business and also to buy machines for her massage business.

loans.use: to buy products to sell and also machines for her massage business

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Oeurn, 46, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been producing brooms to sell for over ten years, earning approximately 1.50 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns approximately 3.50 USD per day. One of her children is a garment worker and earns approximately 3 USD per day.

Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Oeurn is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work. In the future, she would like to expand her business, rebuild her present house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work

loans.name: Mahinbonu

texts.ru: Махинбону родилась в 1990 году в семье служащих. В 1997 году поступила в средную школу №4 и успешно закончила. В 2008 году поступила в Политехнический Институт Технологического Университета Таджикистана на факультет технологии консервирования и пище- концентратов, в настоящее время является студенткой 4 курса. Она активная и целеустремленная девушка, участвует во всех молодежных студенческих мероприятиях. Среди однокурсников имеет хорошую репутацию. Махинбону запрашивает займ для оплаты своего обучения. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Mahinbonu was born in a military family in 1990.  She started a secondary school #4 in 1997 and successfully completed it.  In 2008, she was accepted to the Polytechnic Institute within the Tajikistan Technical University, to the department of conservation technology and food concentrates, where she is currently a fourth-year student.  Mahinbonu is an active and goal-oriented young woman, who participates in all student events.  She has a good reputation among her classmates.  Mahinbonu is requesting this loan to pay for her education.  She relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Ijevan. Laura works at a secondary school as a French teacher. Her husband fulfills private orders for furniture assembly and water pipe installation. 

Laura’s youngest son attends school; her middle son has recently finished serving in the Armenian army and now he is looking for a job; her eldest son is studying at Yerevan State University, Ijevan branch on 4th course in the economy department.  The education fee for a year is 260,000 AMD and  Laura is requesting a loan for 130,000 AMD, which she will use to pay for her son’s second term at University. Laura’s son is fully confident that on graduating from University he will find a good job and help support his family.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education at university.

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en:
Khuraman has been engaged in vegetable selling for 29 years. She is a 53-year-old married woman and has four children aged 33 to 20.  Khuraman started her business with very small capital. Now she sells the vegetables in the old car that belongs her son.

She wants to increase her business and have more income from it to open her own fruit and vegetable shop. Khuraman is asking for 1,200 AZN to buy various sorts of fruits and vegetables for selling.

loans.use: to buy various sorts of fruits and vegetables for selling

loans.name: Darnester

texts.en:
Darnester and her husband founded Spring Ridge Academy, a four-star day care for pre-school aged children in greater New Orleans.  They just opened a second facility in Westwego, Louisiana.  Darnester and her husband are truly devoted to improving day care in Southern Louisiana.  Their first facility is the only four-star rated day care in the area.

A true advocate for quality child care, Darnester points out that Louisiana ranks 49 out of 50 in the United States for quality child care.  She wants that ranking to change and is doing whatever she can to improve the quality of child care in Louisiana.  She is both a Louisiana Pathways Trainer (Child Care Career Development System) and an adviser to the Child Development Association (CDA).  Darnester's dream is to make Spring Ridge Academy a five-star facility and to achieve National Accreditation for her day care facilities.  She is well on her way to making that dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a fence around the day care center and to install a fire alarm system.

loans.name: Geivi

texts.es:
Geivi es una joven madre de familia de 28 años de edad y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su esposo en su casita construida con mucho trabajo, ubicada en un caserío rural en vía de desarrollo por lo que hasta ahora solo tiene el servicio de luz eléctrica, perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande, el mismo que pertenece a la provincia de Piura ubicado a unas 3 horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo 
>
Geivi ha sido desde muy pequeña una persona de negocios por lo que ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa, productos de primera necesidad (bodega) y además a la crianza y posterior comercialización de ganado menor y aves de corral, para lo que ha acondicionado lugares estratégicos para el mantenimiento de sus animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, su esposo es quien participa a diario en cada uno de los negocios que manejan ya que los proyectos trazados los han asumido de manera responsable.
>
Geivi desea surtir más sus negocios ya que considera que hay demanda aun insatisfecha por lo que quiere comprar mercadería para surtir su bodega, compra de ropa y además de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado y así mejorar no solo la calidad de atención si no que también satisfacer las necesidades de todos sus clientes. Todo este proyecto de Geivi le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida como también darle una buena educación a su menor hijo.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
>
Geivi a pesar de ser una joven de 28 años se ha sabido ganar el respeto y cariño de todos sus vecinos quienes no dudan en dar buenas referencias sobre su persona.
texts.en:
Geive is a 28 year old young woman who has one child.  She lives with her husband in a little house that was built with a lot of work.  They currently live in a rural settlement on the path to development.  Up until now it has only had electricity. It is in the Tambogrande district, Piura province.  It is approximately three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Ever since she was very young Geivi has been a business person.  She now sells clothes and basic needs products (grocery store).  She also raises small livestock and poultry.  In order to do so she has set up strategic places behind her house to take care of his animals.

Geivi wishes to stock her businesses more.  She believes there is a still unsatisfied demand.  That is why she wants to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store, buy clothes, and buy balanced feed to fatten the livestock.  That way she will not only improve the quality of care, but she will also be satisfying the needs of all of her customers.  All of Geive’s project will allow her to improve her family’s quality of life.  It will also allow her to give her minor son a good education. 

In spite of being a 28 year old young woman, Geivi has known how to win the respect and affection of all of her neighbors.  The neighbors do not hesitate to give her good personal references.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store, buy clothes, and buy balanced feed to fatten the livestock

loans.name: Aibek

texts.en:
Aibek is 27 years old and lives with his sister and mother in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Western Mongolia. His sister is a college student and his mother is a nurse.

He started a transport business in 2008. He often delivers packages and goods with his truck in the city.  Also, he purchases salvaged cars from the neighboring areas and sells the spare parts of the cars. He plans to buy a salvaged car with the loan.

He is a really diligent guy who says that "I would like to purchase the car and sell the spare parts of it to make a higher income so that I can pay for my brother's college fee". The total amount he is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT for the car for spare parts.

loans.use: to buy car spare parts

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, de 43 años es una mujer independiente. Vive en compañía de Amadeo, su esposo desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Norca y David a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chupaca. Durante las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos, en principal de su esposo quien trabaja en la gobernación de la zona, en construcción de obras, ahí obtiene un sueldo mensual. Después de ello se dirige a sus sembríos de papa, col y maíz. Que cuida con mucho esfuerzo, pues de ello dependen las ganancias durante el año. Ya tiene 15 años dedicándose a la venta de su cosecha en el mercado mayorista donde es muy conocida. Su mayor sueño es contar con sus propios terrenos agrícolas, ya que solo siembra en el de sus abuelos. Para ello trabaja sin descanso, también en la crianza de cuyes, gallinas que comercializa a buen precio y por las tardes vende maca, manzana y demás bebidas calientes en el parque de la ciudad, le va muy bien ya que en ese horario corre viento y hace frió por lo que muchas personas consumen las bebidas calientes que prepara. Ahora quiere en primer lugar terminar de construir su casa. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “chamblachaca” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, pues le agrada ser parte de su asociación. Esther de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en cercar su casa y poner un portón grande.
texts.en:
Esther is 43 years old and a very independent woman. She lives with her husband, Amadeo, whom she has been married to for 17 years. Together they have two children, Norca and David. The family lives together in their own home which is located in Chupaca. In the morning she gets up very early to prepare food, mainly for her husband who works in the area doing construction work, which is where he receives his monthly salary. After that she manages her crops of potato, cabbage and corn. She cares for them with much effort because she depends on them for income throughout the year.  She has 15 years of experience making a living selling her crops in the wholesale market where she is well known. Her greatest dream is to have her own land to farm, right now she is using her grandparents land.

She works without resting because she also raises guinea pigs and chickens that she sells for a good price. And in the afternoons she sells ‘maca’ (a root vegetable), apples and hot drinks in the city park. She does well because at this time of day there is a lot of wind and it is cold, so many people drink the hot drinks she has prepared.  

Now, principally she would like to finish the construction of their house. She is a member of the group “Chamblanchaca” and this is the fifth loan she has taken out through MFP, where she places much hope in small loans to help her accomplish her goals. She promises to be punctual with her payments. She is happy to be a part of her association. Esther, with your support, will invest the money she has requested to build a fence around her home and put in a large gate.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a fence around her home and buy a gate.

loans.name: Lawani

texts.fr:
Lawani est une femme  âgée de 27ans. Elle est mariée å un  mécanicien. Elle a 01 enfant. 
Lawani travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2007.  En plus de son activité de coiffure elle vend des mèches, tissages et des bijoux à ses clients. Elle exerce son activité dans un quartier de la place et achète ses produits au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Lawani a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de mèches, bijoux et autres.
texts.en:
Lawani is 27 years old and married to a mechanic. She has one child.

Lawani has been working as a hairdresser since 2007. As well as being a hairdresser, she also sells hair extensions, hair weaves and jewellery to her customers. She works in her local district and gets her supplies at the Lomé Grand Market.

Lawani has requested her 3rd loan from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions, jewellery and other products.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions etc.

loans.name: Maria Matilde

texts.es: Maria de 53 años de edad  es madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 27 años. Como madre cabeza de hogar ella inició su negocio, para responder transversalmente a las obligaciones de su hogar, es decir generar ingresos mientras atendía las responsabilidades con sus hijos y las domésticas de su vivienda, así fue como después de pedirle a Dios guía para desempeñarse efectivamente, empezó vendiendo productos mediante guías especializadas, que obtuvo a crédito y que a su vez distribuyó entre una clientela doméstica muy cercana, su familia, sus amigas y las recomendadas de estas. En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido  y con ello su capital de trabajo, apoyado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización de la que ha recibido dos créditos, con los que ha podido como ella dice. “comprar mas y vender mas”. Su meta es lograr comodidades en su vida familiar y ampliar la cobertura de su negocio, cumpliendo con el desafío de administrar bien sus ganancias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará perfumes, artículos para el hogar y de bisutería, para continuar otorgándoles crédito a sus clientes entre quienes distribuye su mercancía en cantidades que ellos puedan pagar y a plazos ajustados a sus posibilidades.
texts.en:
Maria, age 53, is the mother of three children, ages 1 to 27 years old. As a single mother heading the family, she started her business to respond to her household obligations, that is, to generate income while she tended to her responsibilities to her children and carried out the domestic chores in her home. Thus it was, after asking for God’s guidance in effectively handling the situation, that she began selling products through specialty catalogs and obtained a loan so that she could distribute them among her intimate clientele, her family, friends and those referred by them.

Currently, Maria’s business has grown and with it her working capital. She has been supported by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization from which she has received two loans that have enabled her, as she says, “to buy more and sell more.”  Her goal is to provide conveniences for her family and to expand her business, complying with the challenge of managing her profits well.

Now she is applying for a loan that she will use to buy perfume, articles for the home and costume jewelry in order to continue offering credit to her customers to whom she distributes merchandise in quantities they can afford and on terms adjusted to their possibilities.

loans.use: to buy perfume, articles for the home and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 2 to 5 years. He describes himself to be hardworking.

He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located at a busy and viable area and his customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent power problems leading to meat loss.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more meat for selling. Sammy's business goal is to run a slaughter house within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more meat for selling

loans.name: Mariana Estefania

texts.es:
Mariana es una mujer de 19 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de CD y bazar. 

Su historia comenzó con un pequeño capital de $200 dólares luego fue creciendo, trabaja sola todos los días, sus dificultades son los ladrones, si está casada el esposo trabaja en fabrica operador de tunas, no tiene hijos, su sueño es trabajar y ahorrar para construir su casa propia. 

Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de CD y papeleria para un bazar.
texts.en:
Mariana is 19 years old and has many aspirations for helping her CD and stationery business to prosper in the coming years.

Mariana's business story began with a small amount of capital ($200) which then grew.  She works alone every day.  The challenge she faces is thieves.  Mariana is married and her husband works in a tuna factory.  They do not have any children.  Mariana's dream is to work and save so that she can build her own home.  She would like this loan to buy CDs and stationery products for a stationery store.

loans.use: to buy CDs and stationery products

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda, de 42 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compañía de 3 de sus 8 hijos a los cuales cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de El Tambo. Se levanta muy temprano para comenzar el día, lleno de trabajo y esfuerzo. Su principal actividad es la venta de lencería para mujeres, edredones, cubrecamas, frazadas y demás, según cuenta sale con su mercadería, ya que nunca sabe cuando algún cliente le pedirá un producto. Se dirige a una casa ajena, donde trabaja lavando la ropa y limpiando los cuarto, sala y patio, ahí le pagan un sueldo mensual, que le ayuda en los gastos económicos. Cuando termina su labor, camina por las calles a ofrecer sus productos, cuenta que gracias a su esfuerzo, ahora cuenta con clientes fijos, pero como no es constante la venta, también sale a ofrecer los productos que no logra vender. Ahora tiene muchos pedidos para esta campaña escolar, algunos ya le están pagando poco a poco, pues ella deja al crédito la ropa que vende, de esa manera les brinda facilidades a sus clientes. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “mujeres solidarias” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está feliz de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Olinda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de camisas, polos blancos y zapatillas que tienen pedido para sus clientes.
texts.en:
42-year-old Olinda is a tenacious woman.  She lives together with three of her eight children who she cares for in her own home, in the town of El Tambo.  Olinda gets up very early to start her day which is full of work and effort.  Her main business activity is selling women's lingerie, comforters, bedspreads, blankets, etc.  She says that she goes out with her merchandise as she never knows when a customer will ask her for something.  She goes to another person's house where she works washing clothes and cleaning bedrooms, living room and patio.  They pay her a monthly wage for this which helps cover her financial expenses.  When she has finished her work, she walks through the streets offering her goods for sale.  She says that, thanks to her efforts, she now has regular customers but, as her sales are not constant, she also goes out to offer the products that she hasn't managed to sell.  Right now, she has lots of orders for the back-to-school season.  Some of her customers are already paying her gradually.  She leaves the clothing that she sells with her customers on credit and provides them with repayment terms.

Olinda belongs to the "Mujeres Solidarias" community bank and this is her second loan from MFP.  She is happy to know that she will have financial support which will help her to make progress in her business.  For her part, she pledges once more to make her repayments on time.  She enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Olinda will invest the money she has requested in buying shirts, white polo shirts and sneakers which her customers have ordered.

loans.use: to buy shirts, white polo shirts and sneakers

loans.name: Klever Heriberto

texts.es:
Klever es un hombre que tiene 34 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los años próximos de prosperar su venta de ropa. 

Su historia empezó desde que trabajaba en fabricas muchos años decide poner su propio negocio de venta de ropa y hasta ahora me  ha ido muy bien su trabajo lo hace sola todos los días sus dificultades es el transporte y por cierto hay muchos ladrones está separado con su esposa, tiene 1 niña de 1 años de edad.

Su sueño es un local de venta de ropa y comprarme un auto. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de ropa hombres y mujer etc.
texts.en:
Klever is a 34 year-old man who has many aspirations to succeed in his clothes selling business in the years to come.

His story began after working in factories for many years when he decided to start his own business selling clothing and it has gone very well until now. He works alone every day. His challenges include transportation and of course the many thieves that abound. He is separated from his wife and has a one year-old daughter.

His dream is to have a shop to sell clothes and to buy himself an automobile. Consequently he would like the loan to buy clothing for men and women, etc.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo est un homme âgé de 33 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et a 01 enfant.  
Kodjo travaille comme revendeur de pièces détachées depuis 2006.  Il achète au Port Autonome de Lomé et répond à la demande de ses clients dans une boutique.
Kodjo a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des disques, des dents de chaines, des pneus …..
texts.en:
Kodjo is 33 years old, married to a saleswoman and father to one child.

Kodjo has been selling spare parts since 2006. He gets his supplies in the Autonomous Port of Lomé and serves his customers in a shop.

Kodjo is requesting his 3rd loan from WAGES in order to buy brake discs, tooth chains, tyres, etc.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Adja Maimouna

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Maimouna est âgée de 27 ans. Elle habite au Sénégal  et est caissière depuis 3 ans  dans un restaurant de la place. Elle  a commencé  par être  serveuse avant d’être caissière.  Ce qui l’intéresse  dans son activité c’est la vigilance et les rencontres avec d’autres cultures. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2009 et a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour  d’une part supporter  les frais médicaux de sa maman qui est actuellement  malade et d’autres part elle va utiliser le reste de l’argent pour acheter des cheveux naturels qu’elle va revendre a ses connaissances.
texts.en:
Maimouna is 27 years old and lives in Senegal. She has been a cashier in a local restaurant for 3 years. She started off as a waitress before becoming a cashier. What she finds interesting about her job is learning to be diligent and attentive, and meeting people from other cultures.

She has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since 2009 and has already repaid a previous loan. She is requesting a loan of 400 000 francs which will be used in part to pay for her mother's medical expenses (she is currently ill), and in part to buy natural hair which she will resell to her acquaintances.

loans.use: to buy natural hair for resale and pay her mother's medical expenses.

loans.name: Buyuni Group

texts.en:
Ahmad is in his mid-20s and single.  He has been running a food shop for six years.  He works from 7:00 A.M. to 9.00 P.M. daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his second loan from Jujijenge Tanzania Limited. He used the previous loan to re-stock missing items in his shop and pay household expenses.  He has paid back all of his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy 50 kilos of sugar, 50 kilos of rice, 30 kilos of wheat flour, 30 kilos of backing flour and a bucket of cooking oil.  His dream is to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Buyuni," which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: buy stock for his food shop.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 39 years old, married to her husband Sammy and blessed with three children ages 12, 8 and 4.  She owns an auto parts shop that she started 10 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more spare parts for re-sale.  Her profit will help her pay her children's school fees.  She hopes to pay her children's fees on time and meet their needs.  This is her first loan.

loans.use: buy spare auto parts for re-sale.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is 35 years old, married, and has three children.  She resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in animal husbandry for over two years and is successful in her career. She is involved in fattening up pigs and poultry to sell and earns approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a logger and earns approximately $4 per day. 

In order to improve business, Sopheap is requesting for a loan for $1,200 to purchase fodder for breeding pigs and poultry in order to sell at a profitable price. In the future, she would like expand her poultry farm and support her children to study until they earn a bachelor's degree. She hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide a comfortable living condition for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for breeding pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Ndeye Diakhou

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye  Diakhou est âgée  de 39ans et habite au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce est pratique la vente de jus locaux, de glace, de sandwichs, d’habits et de déodorants. Elle a choisi cette activité de commerce dans le but de lutter contre l’oisiveté et de  pouvoir subvenir a ses besoins personnels. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus  dans son activité ce sont les retombées financières. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2004 et a déjà remboursé 3 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour s’approvisionner en produits divers  et remplir la cantine dans laquelle elle exerce son activité de commerce. Ce financement lui permettra de  développer son activité génératrice de revenus.
texts.en: Mrs. Ndeye Diakhou is 39 years old and lives in Senegal. She works as a vendor selling local juices, ice, sandwiches, clothing and deodorant. She has chosen this kind of business in order to fight precarious economic conditions and be able to support herself. The financial aspect is what interests her most in this work. She has been a member of a local branch of U-IMCEC since March 2004, and already repaid three prior loans. She is seeking a loan of 500,000 West African francs to stock up on various  articles and replenish her vending booth. This financing will allow her to develop her income-generating activity further.

loans.use: achat de produits divers a commercialiser

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Madame Diarra est une veuve de 49 ans. Elle est agent municipal contractuel depuis 15 ans. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEc depuis juin 2003. Elle a déjà  remboursé 3 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un  crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour finir le dallage de sa maison. Ce financement l’aidera a mettre en location une partie de sa maison et  par conséquent accroitre ses revenus  et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diarra is a 49-year-old widow. She has been a municipal officer, working on a contractual basis, for 15 years.

Diarra has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since June 2003 and has already repaid 3 previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs to spend on completing the tiling of her house. This financing will enable her to rent out a part of her house, thereby increasing her revenues and allowing her to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to complete construction on her house.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Sénégal. Elle est gérante de multiservices depuis 8 ans. Auparavant  elle  était   opératrice de saisie. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa zone d’habitation depuis novembre 2005. Elle a déjà remboursé 6 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour la fabrication d’une cantine en fer pour les besoins de son activité. Son objectif est d’élargir son activité pour accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Aminata is 41 years old and lives in Senegal. She has been a full service manager for 8 years. Before that, she was a data entry operator.

Aminata has been a member of her local UIMCEC branch since November 2005 and has already repaid 6 previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 400 000 francs to spend on building an iron canteen for her business. Her aim is to expand her business and increase her revenues.

loans.use: to build an iron canteen.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria de 53 años de edad  madre de 3 hijos, vive  al sur de la ciudad donde vende comidas rápidas, refrescos y sopas diariamente y también los fines de semanas ofrece a su clientela, productos variados como  pasteles y frituras, actividad que inició, con el fin de aumentar los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. En su negocio le ha ido muy bien y está entusiasmada en hacerlo crecer,  hasta convertirlo en un restaurante muy conocido y cotizado por su clientela. Su volumen de ventas se ajusta a la infraestructura de su negocio,  pero gradualmente aumentan los clientes que consumen sus productos y es ahí cuando su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para atender su demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  porque requiere hacer compras de contado y en mayor volumen de materias primas para la preparación de sus alimentos, con el fin de ganar descuentos, así mismo comprará ollas de un mayor tamaño, pues está preparando sus alimentos en ollas pequeñas en el patio de su casa y en leña. Su inversión será exitosa porque ganará descuentos; así mismo como  la hace en una época de gran demanda comercial como los carnavales, en los cuales las festividades se toman a la ciudad y la gente no cocina sino que compra sus alimentos y refrescos , se incrementarán sus ventas, como usualmente ocurre, por eso Maria debe estar preparada para ganar mas dinero y aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria, 53, is the mother of three children. She lives in the southern part of the city where she sells fast food, soft drinks and soup every day and also on weekends. She offers her customers a variety of products such as cakes and fritters. She started the business with the goal of increasing income to support her family. Her business has gone very well and she is enthusiastic about seeing it grow, even having it converted into a very well known and highly esteemed restaurant by her customers. 

Maria’s sales volume is adjusted to her business infrastructure but she has gradually increased her clientele and that is when her working capital is insufficient to meet the demand. That is why she has come to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for her first loan because she needs to make higher volume cash purchases of the basic ingredients used in preparing her food so she can get discounts. As well she wants to buy larger sized cooking pots since she is now preparing her food in small pots in the patio of her house over wood fires. 

Her investment will be successful because she will get discounts and also she is making it at a time of high demand such as carnival season when there are festivities in the city and people do not cook but rather go out for food and drink. Her sales will increase as has happened before. Consequently Maria needs to be prepared to earn more money and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to make higher volume cash purchases of the basic ingredients used to prepare her food so she can get discounts and to also buy larger-sized cooking pots.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 32 years old, single, and has two children. She has been selling handbags for seven years with a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which she uses to support her children.

Priscilla is requesting her first loan from  KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more handbags to sell.  She was introduced to KADET by an existing  customer. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her dream is to open a boutique shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase handbags.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough spacious room for operation. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for selling.  Nicholas' business goal is to expand his clothes store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 41, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker who earns approximately USD $4 per day. Two of her children are employed as construction workers. 

Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Touch is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.
 
In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate more income to support the family and support her children to study higher. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and bigger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Jhany Margarita

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta por catalogo de productos de belleza, la socia vende a sus compañeras y compañeros de trabjao los diferentes productos de belleza y tambien a otras instituciones, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de productos en oferta para tener almacenado y poder vender un un porcentaje diferenciado.
texts.en:
The borrower is continuing with her business buying and selling beauty products by catalog. She sells beauty products to her male and female co-workers, and also to other institutions. 

She wishes to use the loan to buy products that are on sale, in order to store them, and sell them with various markups.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 35-year-old business lady. She is married to Martin. They are blessed with two children. She has been running a beauty salon for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Cecilia will use the loan to pay school fees for her child. 

With the anticipated profit from the salon business she will educate her other child. Her hopes and dreams are to add cosmetics to her salon.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en:
Nyamdorj, 53, lives with his unemployed 51-year-old wife in Arhangai province of Central Mongolia. He contributes to the family income and sends money to his two children. The operator of a wooden furniture production business since 2000, Nyamdorj has been doing well but due to a lack of finances, needs to get his supplies a few times a month but would like to buy them in larger quantities.

Nyamdorj is a gentle man who says, "I would like to expand my business by getting the supplies in large quantities so that I can save much for my family." He is therefore requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to buy wood to make the door and upper frame of a ger.

loans.use: to buy wood to make the door and upper frame of a ger.

loans.name: Ana Carlota

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer que tiene 36 años de edad (en la foto aparece con su familia) y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los años próximos de prosperar su pequeña panaderia.

La historia empezó desde que comenzo a prepara pan en un horno pequeño, poco a poco comenzo a producir en masa los panes. Junto con su esposo en la actualidad trabajando ya que es el negocio que le ayuda a generar ingresos para toda su familia. Poco a poco han incrementado la produccion de panes debido a que la genet del sector donde viven les gusta. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el prestamo para comprar sacos de harina, levadura, manteca, huevos, leche y fabricar con una mayor produccion los panes.
texts.en:
Ana is a 36 year old woman.  (In the photo, she appears with her family).  She has great aspirations about seeing her small bakery prosper in the coming years. 

The story began when Ana started baking bread in a small oven.  Little by little she started producing the bread en masse.  She is currently working together with her husband, since the business is helping to generate income for the whole family.  Bit by bit, they have increased the bread production, as the people where live really like it.

Ana has great aspirations with regard to her business, and that is why she wants a loan.  She wants to purchase sacks of flour, yeast, lard, eggs and milk to increase her bread production.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, lard, eggs and milk.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Mrs. Suy, 33, a married mother of one child attending a local public primary school, has been raising hogs both for slaughter and offspring for three years, typically earning an average of $1.50 per day. Now requesting a KHR 2,800,000 loan through HKL to purchase six pigs to raise for eventual sale, Suy would like to save money to build and expand her pig-fattening business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase six pigs to raise for future sale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 30-year-old business lady. She is the single mother of one child, aged nine years. She has been running a retail shop for the past two years. Her monthly income is KES 9,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mercy will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar, rice, and maize meal for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, rice, and maize meal for her business.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married and has six children who attend school. She operates a coconuts selling business and sells her goods at the market. She has worked in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are the local are residents. 

 Mwanajuma is requesting a loan for 25,000 KES, which she will use to purchase more coconuts to sell. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality.  Her highest monthly expense is food.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanajuma aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Norn, 36, is married and resides with her husband, a truck driver earning approximately USD 5 per day, and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Norn has been selling groceries for over 10 years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. In order to develop her business, she is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more profit for the family.

In the future, Norn would like to build a grocery store in the front of her house and support her children's studies until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to raise capital to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 51 años de edad (aparece con su esposo en la foto) y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comidas rápidas. 

Su historia comenzó hace algunos años se canso de trabajar en fabricas y me puse mi propio restaurante, trabaja junto a su esposo todos los días, sus dificultades son las enfermedades ya que hay mucho polvo, si  está casada su esposo la ayuda con el negocio y también se dedica a la albañilería, no tiene hijos, su sueño es hacer mi local de cemento y con vidrio ya que entra mucho polvo. 

El préstamo lo quiere para su negocio de comidas rápidas y comprar viveres como carnes, granos, panes, vegetales etc.
texts.en:
María is a 51-year-old woman (she appears in the photo with her husband) who has many hopes for her fast-food store to prosper in the coming years.

Her story began a few years ago.  She tired of working in factories and she set up her own restaurant.  She works with her husband every day.  Her difficulties are sickness because there is a lot of dust.  If she is tired her husband helps her with the business.  He also works in building.  She does not have children.  Her dream is to make her store of cement and glass because a lot of dust gets in.

She wants the loan for her fast-food business and to buy food such as meat, grains, bread, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: to buy meat, grains, bread, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Ney es un hombre de 31 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de frutas.

Su historia comenzó en 1998 vino del campo conoció a la que es actualmente su esposa se decidió a vender mangos, trabaja con la esposa, tiene dificultades principalmente la delincuencia y en invierno las enfermedades,  la esposa le ayuda a pelar los mangos, tiene 2 hijos pequeños de 9 y 7 años están en escuela fiscal cerca de la vivienda, su sueño es hacer mi casita e incrementar su negocio y comprarme una ropita. 

Quiere el préstamo para su venta de mangos en su triciclo ya que los vende ambulantemente en las calles.
texts.en:
Ney is 31 years old and has many aspirations to prosper in the coming years by selling fruit.

His story began in 1998, when he came in from the fields, met his now wife, and decided to begin selling mangos with her.  He has some problems, primarily with the crime, and with illness in the winter.  His wife helps him peel the mangos.  He has two young children, ages 9 and 7, who attend the nearby public school.  His dreams are to build a small house, grow his business, and buy himself some new clothes.

He wants this loan so that he can begin selling his mangos on a tricycle, since he sells in the streets.

loans.use: to buy a tricycle so that he can sell his fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is applying for another loan to start a motorcycle transportation business.  She will use the 41,328 KES loan to purchase a motorcycle for her new motorcycle transportation business. In the future, Bintihamisi aspires to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Bintihamisi has greatly improved her family’s standard of living.  She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her new motorcycle transportation business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, de 45 años es una mujer responsable. Tubo 8 hijos a los que crío sola, ahora vive en compañía de Arturo el menor de sus hijos, a quien cuida en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Tambo. Su vida se centró en el trabajó duro. Le costó mucho adquirir lo que hoy posee, ya que se separó de su esposo. Su principal actividad económica se centra en la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una tienda de comestibles que puso en su casa, donde vende carne, verdura y demás productos muy surtidos. Ya tiene 6 años de experiencia, y en todo este tiempo obtuvo muchos clientes, ya que realiza chupetes de yogurt que les gusta a los niños y adultos. Los fines de semana realiza Comida en un espacio que acondiciona en su tienda, todo esto le ayuda a tener cada vez más clientes. Además de vender yogurt natural que ella misma elabora, lo cual reparte en sociedad con un señor quien vende 80 litros a la semana, y ya al finalizar el mes sacar sus ganancias y se reparten de forma equitativa. Ahora desea expandirse más para poder ser conocida y crear su propia marca, “eso es mi sueño”, afirma. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “mujeres solidarias” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está feliz de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Ana de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Ana is 45 years old and is a very responsible woman.  She raised eight children on her own and now she lives with Arturo, her children’s mentor, which she cares for in her own home located in Tambo.  Her life has centered around hard work and it took a lot for her to acquire the things she has, since she separated from her husband.

Her main economic activity centers around her sale of primary needs products from the food store she set up in her home.  There she sells meat, vegetables, and other assortments of products.  She’s been doing this for six years and she has gained many customers during that time, now that she makes yogurt pops that children and adults both enjoy.  On the weekends she sells food in a space she set up in her store.  All of this helps her gain even more customers.  Besides selling natural yogurt, that she makes herself and of which she and her husband sell 80 liters per week, they take their earnings at the end of the month and divide them equally.

Now she wants to expand and create her own brand.  “This is my dream,” she says.  She is a member of the “mujeres solidarias” (United Women) group and this will be her second loan through MFP, when she is happy to know that she will have some financial backing so that she can achieve her dream.

She also likes the group because all of the members are responsible and united.

She will use the money from this loan to buy primary needs products for her store.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Byambatsogt

texts.en:
Byambatsogt is a 50-year-old man who lives with his wife and four children in the Hovd Province of Western Mongolia.  His wife is a shop assistant.  Two of his children study at the college and the other two go to the local high school.  

Byambatsogt is a mechanist and got his specialization in Russia.  He started his car repair business in 1990. Normally, he repairs cars by subscription. When the subscription is great, he repairs two-four barrel car motors.  In wintertime his business stops because, due to the heavy snowfall in rural areas, there are not many cars on the roads. Therefore, the only time he can run the business and save for his family's needs is from March to November.  Now he plans to buy supplies in large quantities so he can run the business.

He is a professional mechanist who says, "I would like to expand my business by getting supplies in large quantities so that I can save for my children's tuition fees". The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT to buy the spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase spare auto parts.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam, 54, is widowed and resides with her two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites, including the ancient temples of Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey.  She and her daughter have been working in a massage shop for over 6 years, earning approximately $7.50 USD for each massage.  In order to improve her family's economy, Sam is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD to purchase a motorbike for her son to run as a motor taxi to generate more income to support the family.  In the future, she would like to rebuild her house to make it much stronger and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: purchase a motorbike for her son to run as motor taxi.

loans.name: Rufo

texts.es: Rufo, de 40 años, es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el distrito de Chilca. La ciudad de Huancayo es muy grande, el tráfico cada vez es mayor. Por ello los pobladores se trasladan con taxis. Rufo, miró en esta necesidad una oportunidad. Por ello desde hace 4 años, comenzó a  trabaja ofreciendo el servicio de transporte con el auto que adquirió hace poco y se convirtió en su herramienta de trabajo. Todos los días desde muy temprano recorre las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de clientes que soliciten transportarlos a distintos puntos de la ciudad y cobra de acuerdo a la distancia. “Si es en la zona urbana, es menos, de cono a cono es mucho más el precio”, comenta. Considera que su trabajo es rentable porque el servicio que ofrece es muy solicitado. Además  siempre trata en lo posible de recorrer zonas urbanas, que significa en su negocio; prolongar el funcionamiento de su movilidad y retrasar el desgaste. Es por esta razón que desea, mejorar y tener un carro más para obtener mejores ganancias. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “las emprendedoras” y este es el décimo noveno crédito con MFP, donde está feliz de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Rufo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero en la compra de repuestos y el pago de mantenimiento mecánico de su carro
texts.en:
40-year-old Rufo is a hard-working man.  He lives together with his wife and two children in a rented house, in Chilca district.  The city of Huancayo is very big and there is an awful lot of traffic.  For this reason, the locals travel around in taxis.  Rufo saw this need as an opportunity.  Four years ago he started offering a transport service with a car that he had just acquired and turned the car into his work tool.  Every day, from very early in the morning, he drives round the streets of his city in search of customers who ask him to transport them to different parts of the city.  He charges according to the distance traveled.  "If the trip is in an urban area, I charge less but from cone to cone [outlying district to outlying district] the price is much higher", he says  Rufo considers his work to be profitable because the service he offers is very much in demand.  In addition, he always tries, as far as possible, to cover the urban areas because in his business this means that he prolongs the life of his vehicle and delays wear and tear.  Rufo would like to improve his business and own an additional car so that he can make better profits.

Rufo is a member of the "Las Emprendedoras" community bank and this is his 19th loan from MFP.  He is happy to know that he will have financial support and be able to make progress in his business.  For his part, he pledges once again to make his repayments on time.  He enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Rufo will invest his money in buying spare parts and pay to have maintenance work carried out on his car.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to pay a mechanic to carry out maintenance work on his vehicle

loans.name: Edison Roberto

texts.es:
Edison es un hombre de 21 años de edad, tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de artículos de hogar.

Su historia comenzó por tratar de ayudar a su mama porque era madre soltera y se compro una motocicleta de segunda, tiene dificultades son el sector es un poco peligroso los ladrones seria un serio problema, está soltero, no tiene hijos, su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y terminar su casa. 

Quiere el préstamo para su venta de artículos de hogar y asi generar mas ingresos y ayuda a la familia con los gastos.
texts.en:
Edison is a 21-year-old man who has a great desire to boost his business over the next few years.  His business is selling household goods.

Edison's business story started when he tried to help his mom because she was a single mother and he bought a second-hand motorcycle.  The difficulty he faces is that his area is a little dangerous and thieves are a serious problem.  Edison is single and doesn't have any children.  His dream is to improve his quality of life and finish building his house.

Edison would like a loan for his business selling household goods so that he can make more income and help his family with their expenses.

loans.use: to buy household goods

loans.name: Khudoyberdi

texts.ru: Худойберди женат. Ему 26 лет. У нее двое детей. Он занимается животноводством. В этой области он три года. Кредит берет для закупа мелко – рогатого скота.
texts.en: Khudoyberdi is 26 years old. He is married and has two children. He has been raising farm animals for three years. Khudoyberdi is taking this loan to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock
