loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael de 60 años es un hombre casado con Virginia, con quien tiene 3 hijos pero solo vive con 2 de 13 y 10 años. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Palomar, distrito de río Negro, provincia de Satipo. Ismael es dedicado y meticuloso en sus quehaceres. Se dedica a la agricultura. En sus 3 cuadras de terrenos de cultivos siembra maíz, café y cacao. De los cuales el café y el cacao le brindan mayores ingresos, pero son anuales. Mientras tanto el maíz, se cosecha cada 4 meses, y es el producto que lo salva de algunos apuros como son las deudas, o gastos diarios. Empezó en esta actividad desde muy joven. A sus 20 años ya contaba con terrenos propios. Y el café es su especialidad. Hoy en día, trabaja con 1 cuadra de la misma, ya que a su edad, no puede esforzarse mucho. “En cada cosecha obtengo 5 sacos, pero con el cacao ya puedo generar más dinero”, menciona. Sería la segunda vez que Ismael accedería a un préstamo de MFP. Por eso se compromete a pagar las cuotas con puntualidad como antes lo hizo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Kontonas de Palomar”, todos los integrantes son varones fuertes y comprometidos con el trabajo. Se siente a gusto de pertenecerlo. Invertirá el dinero en el pago del personal para la limpieza de su cafetal, ya que la cosceha empezará a partir del mes de febrero.
texts.en:
60-year-old Ismael is married to Virginia.  The couple have three children but only live with two of them (who are 13 and 10 years old).  The family live in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Palomar, in Río Negro district, in Satipo province.  Ismael is committed and meticulous in his work.  His business is farming.  Over three 'cuadras' (unit of measurement for agricultural land), he grows corn, coffee and cacao.  The coffee and cacao make him the most income but they are annual whilst the corn is harvested every four months and this is the crop that gets him out of some tight spots with debts or daily expenses.  He started out in this business when he was very young.  At 20 years of age, he already had his own farmland.  Coffee is his specialty.  These days he grows coffee over one 'cuadra' because, at his age, he can't work so hard.  "With each harvest, I get 5 sacks but with the cacao I can make more money", he says.

This will be Ismael's second loan from MFP.  He pledges to make his repayments on time as he did with his previous loan.  He belongs to "Los Kontonas de Palomar" community bank.  All the members are strong men who are committed to their work.  He feels happy to be a member.  Ismael will invest his money in paying laborers to weed his coffee plantation as harvest time begins in the month of February.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Rosa Lucila

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera de con 2 hijos los cuales aun están en edad escolar, cuanta con casa propia en la que viven junto a sus dos menores hijos, casa la cual está ubicada en  el  Caserío rural de nombre “Nueva Esperanza”  del Distrito de Las Lomas, el cual se encuentra a 30 minutos de la Provincia de Piura Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito, su caserío aun no cuenta con los servicios básicos indispensables como es el agua y la luz eléctrica. 

Rosa se dedica desde muy joven a distintas actividades de comercio, debido a que sus padres le inculcaron a ser una mujer responsable, con el tiempo Rosa a logrado ahorrar su dinero y vio como oportunidad de negocio la compra de 7 vacas lecheras, leche la cual ahora comercializa de manera diaria ya sea por que los clientes llegan a su casa o es que ella misma recorre los mercados locales para su venta, adicionalmente también con la ayuda de sus hijos ella vende pollo y gaseosas en un ambiente acondicionado de su casa lo que le permite generar otros ingresos a la canasta familiar.

Rosa siempre esta buscando oportunidades de negocio o de seguir surgiendo de alguna manera, es por eso que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2500 Nuevos Soles para la compra de alimento balanceado y así mejorar la producción de sus vacas, y también comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir su negocio.

Junto a sus hijos han sabido siempre mantenerse solos y por eso han luchado juntos por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, pues cuentan con buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales.
texts.en:
Rosa, 37, is the single mother of 2 children who are still in school.  She has her own house where she lives with her 2 minor children, which is located a rural settlement called "Nueva Esperanza" in the Las Lomas district, which is 30 minutes from Piura province.  Rosa lives in the rural part of this district, and in her settlement they lack basic utilities such as water and electricity.

Ever since she was very young, Rosa has been engaged in a number of retail businesses, since her parents impressed upon her the need to be a responsible woman.  Over time, Rosa managed to save some money, and she saw a business opportunity to buy 7 dairy cows, from which she now sells milk on a daily basis. She sells to customers who come to her house to buy, and she also goes around the local markets to make her sales.  In addition, with the help of her children, she sells chicken and soft drinks from a spot she set up for this business in her home.  This allows her to earn extra income to pay for the household's basic needs.

Rosa is always seeking out business opportunities, or opportunities to increase her existing businesses.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for Edpyme Alternativa for the sum of 2,500 Peruvian soles, so that she can buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals, and in this way increase her cows' production.  In addition, she will buy some consumer goods to stock her business.

Rosa and her children have always known how to support themselves, and they have struggled together to improve their living conditions.  They have good personal and work references.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her dairy cows, and staple consumer goods for her business.

loans.name: Las Carmelitas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Flora María, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, los que son su motivo e inspiración para superarse.
La Sra. Flora María forma parte del grupo "Las Carmelitas", integrado por 8 socias muy emprendedoras, las cuales la eligieron como Secretaria de la Junta Directiva de su grupo. Ellas viven en las Lomas de Carabayllo en el distrito de Carabayllo.
Desde hace tres años ella se dedica a la administración y atención de una cabina de internet de su propiedad ubicada en su domicilio; gracias a este negocio ella ha logrado estabilidad económica, apoyar en la mantención de sus nietos y a la vez hacer crecer éste negocio.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el mantenimiento y arreglos de sus equipos de computo.
texts.en:
Flora María is 53 years old, married, and has five children who are her motivation and inspiration to do well.  She belongs to the "Las Carmelitas" group which is made up of eight very entrepreneurial women who chose her as the group's secretary.  The ladies all live in Lomas de Carabayllo, in Carabayllo district.

For three years, Flora María has been managing and serving in an Internet cafe business which is located in her home.  Thanks to this business, she has managed to achieve financial stability, support her grandchildren and, at the same time, grow her business.  She will invest this loan in having maintenance work and repair work carried out on her computer equipment.

loans.use: to have maintenance work and repair work carried out on her computer equipment

loans.name: Antonio Basilio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 70 años pero es un joven en espíritu, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, cuyas edades comprendes 19 y 16 años y ambos se cursan quinto año de secundaria, su pareja lo apoya mucho en todo lo que hace, el nos cuenta que ella es su mano derecha además lo complace  cuando le prepara su platillo favorito que es el Trigo con bistec, Antonio solo tuvo estudios primarios, pero le hubiera gustado terminar la escuela pero por motivos de pocos recursos económicos no pudo hacerlo.

Antonio trabaja como reciclador, se levanta muy temprano para  empezar sus labores y trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias, es muy dedicado, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene experiencia en este trabajo.

Antonio está agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado el podrá comprar cobre y aluminio, con lo que le permitirá tener más productos para ofrecer, esta mejora le permitirá seguir luchando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener un taller de procesamiento de reciclaje”.
texts.en:
Antonio is 70 years old but is young in spirit, he is married with two children. His children are 19 and 16 and both are enrolled in 5th grade of secondary school. His wife supports him greatly in everything that he does. He told us that she is his right hand and that it pleases him greatly when she makes his favorite dish, wheat with steak. Antonio only studied in elementary school, he would have liked to finish school but was not able to due to lack of economic resources.   

Antonio makes a living by recycling. He gets up very early to start working and works about 8 hours a day. He is very dedicated and believes that he does well in his business because he has experience in this line of work.  

Antonio is thankful for the loans he has received from Kiva, thanks to the support he has received he can buy copper and aluminum. By doing so he will have more products to offer. This improvement will help him continue moving forward towards accomplishing his great dream: to have his own recycle processing shop.

loans.use: to buy copper and aluminum

loans.name: Oswal

texts.es:
Oswal de 21 años, convive con Bertha, la madre de sus 2 hijos de 3 y 1 año. Él y su familia viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Palomar, en el distrito de Río Negro, provincia de Satipo. Oswal es padre trabajador. A su corta edad ya viene laborando con eficiencia dentro del campo. Cuenta con 2 cuadras de terrenos de cultivos, donde siembra café y cacao. Con ambos productos puede mantener a su familia y empezar a ahorrar para futuros gastos. 
Bertha también le ayuda en el trabajo, después de atender la casa y a los hijos. “El trabajo es bien cansado y necesita bastante tiempo”, comenta. Pero aún así, tiene que luchar para sacar adelante a su familia.
Sus metas son claras. Una de ellas es ahorrar el dinero suficiente para adquirir algunos artefactos que le faltan en su hogar. Así también brindarles una educación de calidad a sus hijos. Sería la segunda vez que Oswal obtendrá un préstamo gracias a su ayuda. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Afirma sentirse contento con su banco comunal llamado “Los Kontonas de Palomar”.
Con el dinero que recibiría, pagará a los jornaleros a quienes contratará para realizar la limpieza y mantenimiento de sus cultivos de cacao y café.
texts.en:
21-year-old Oswal lives with Bertha, the mother of his two children who are 3 years old and 1 year old.  He and his family live in their own home, in the indigenous community of Palomar, in Río Negro, in Satipo province.  Oswal is a hard-working father.  Despite his young age, he already works efficiently on his farmland.  He has 2 'cuadras' (agricultural measurement of land) where he grows coffee and cacao.  With these two products he is able to support his family and begin to save up for future expenses.

Bertha helps Oswal in his work after taking care of the house and the children.  "The work is very tiring and takes a lot of time", she says.  However, even so, they have to work hard to provide for their family.

Oswal's goals are clear.  One of his goals is to save up enough money to acquire some items that they lack at home.  He would also like to provide his children with a good-quality education.  This will be the second loan that Oswal has received thanks to your help.  He pledges to be punctual in making his monthly repayments.  He says that he feels happy with his community bank which is called "Los Kontonas de Palomar".  With his money, Oswal will pay laborers who he will hire to weed his land and maintain his cacao and coffee crops.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman.  She has two children between 15 and 20 years old.  She describes herself as ambitious.  She operates a store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as pineapple, tomatoes, watermelon, bananas, oranges, mangoes, onions and kale.  She has been involved in this business for three years.  Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge as a shortage of vegetables and fruits. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.  Margaret's business goal is to run a big farm of vegetables and fruits within five years.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 30-year-old, married woman with four children.  Three of her children are in school.  She has had a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan for three years.

Christine is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice.  She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase food for her food stall.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Ivan  es el propietario de un taller de electrónica en la ciudad de Cartagena, donde vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 8 a 22 años. En su pequeño taller repara principalmente equipos de sonidos y televisores. Sus clientes están ubicados en los barrios aledaños a su negocio, donde ofrece este servicio y poco a poco gana nuevos clientes, con los que hace negociaciones de estricto contado. Su negocio inició después de su experiencia de trabajo en un taller de una empresa reconocida, donde se desempeñaba como técnico electrónico. Su impulso emprendedor lo llevó a independizarse y hoy sueña con el crecimiento de su negocio, pero su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para el tamaño de su meta. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domino, mediante el cual comprará implementos de trabajo,  como juegos de destornilladores,  estantes y lámparas, para hacer mas efectivo su desempeño y lograr tener un ambiente confortable y bien ordenado para realzar su imagen ante su distinguida clientela.
texts.en: Elvin is the owner of a electronics shop in the city of Cartagena. where he lives with his spouse and their three children who are between the ages of 8 and 22. In his small shop he mainly does repairs on sound systems and televisions. His customers are located in the neighborhoods near his business, where he goes around offering his services and little by little has gained new customers. He does business strictly for cash only. He started his business after having experience working in a shop of a well known business, where he worked as a electronics technician. His entrepreneurial drive led him to open his own business and today his dream is to grow his business, but his working capital is insufficient for the size of his goal. He is currently applying for a loan from Kiva, which will be his first loan through 'Fundación Mario Santo Domino', which he will use to buy work tools like screwdriver sets, shelves and lamps. This will help him work more effectively, have a comfortable atmosphere, and be well organized to present a good image to his distinguished customers.

loans.use: to buy tools for work like screwdriver sets, shelves and lamps.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 25 year old a married woman with three children, one is in school. She has a business of selling food at a stall in yambio south sudan for two years.
Mariam is requesting this loan through BRAC south sudan to purchase cassava flour and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour and rice for sale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 35 years old, a boutique owner in Mariakani. She is married and has been running the boutique for the past one year. Her business is doing great.

This is her first business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more skirts, trousers, sweaters and shirts for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase more stock. 

She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more skirts, trousers, sweaters and shirts for sale.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en: Pha, 48, is widowed and resides with three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice for over ten years and is successful in her career. All of her children are employed at garment factory. In order to improve her agricultural business, Pha is requesting for a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to run a new business of selling groceries to generate more income for the family and rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide a better living condition for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is 58 years old lady, from Majengo area of Vihiga and is married to Benson and they have four children.

Terry operates a dairy farming business and has been in this for the last four years. From the business, she is able to make a monthly income of KES. 16,000. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET which she will use to buy dairy feeds. Her profits will be used to repay back the loan.Her dream is to grow her business through KADET loaning.

loans.use: To buy Dairy Feeds.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun, 47, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in agricultural business for over twenty years, have an extensive experience and are successful in her career. Two of her children are employed at garment factory. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Hun is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her children for commuting to work. By doing so, her children would be able to save some money on her transportation expense to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and much stronger to provide a better living condition for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children for commuting to work

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a married woman. She has 5 children and all are enrolled in school. Amina operates a café. She's worked in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are the local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Amina will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice, beans and cooking oil for her café. Amina aspires to establish a hotel in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice, beans and cooking oil for her café.

loans.name: Srey Neang

texts.en:
Srey Neang, 30, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over 5 years, earning approximately 2 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns approximately 3 USD per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Srey Neang is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase cattle to breed in order to sell for a profitable price when they gain weight. By doing so, she would generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business by purchasing more cattle and pigs to breed to make more money for the family. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her present house to be larger and much stronger to provide better living conditions for her family, as well as support her children to study higher.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and sell

loans.name: Lot

texts.en: Lot, 25, is married, and resides with his parents, his wife and a baby in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for historical tourism sites like the ancient temples of Angkor Wat, Bayon and Banteay Srey.  He has been working as a construction foreman for over 6 years and earning approximately $8 US per day.  His wife is a homemaker who is looking after a six-month-old baby. Due to the difficulty of traveling to work, Lot is requesting  a loan of $700 US to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.  In the future, he would like to build a new house to live separately from his parents and send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 6 years. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, lovaes of bread, tea leaves, sodas etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock of home product for selling. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to to buy home product such as sodas, wheat flour, salt, sugar, bread, sugar etc. Paulines's business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy home products such as sodas, wheat flour, salt, sugar, bread, sugar etc. to resell

loans.name: Shohsanam

texts.ru: Шохсанам жительница Яванского района. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Его муж занимается строительными работами по найму. Каждое лето он ездит в Россию на заработки. Сама она более шести лет занимается животноводством. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Shohsanam is a resident of the Yavan district.  She is 43 years old, married and has five children.  Her husband is involved in construction work as a contractor.  Every summer, he travels to Russia for work.  Shohsanam has been involved in animal husbandry for over six years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase bulls.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Nyiro

texts.en: Nyiro is a married woman. She has a son who is  four years old. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, loaves of bread, tea leaves, sodas etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at a  viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock of home product for selling. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy home product such as sodas, wheat flour, salt, sugar, bread, sugar etc. Nyiro's dream and hope in the future, is to build a nice house .

loans.use: to buy more home product for selling such as sodas, wheat flour, salt, sugar, bread, sugar

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 year old a married woman with six children, all of them are in school. she has a business of a food stall in yambio south sudan for one year.
Elizabeth is requesting this loan through BRAC south sudan to purchase onion, sugar. she will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee.

loans.use: to purchase onions, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat is a good mother of four children who are all in school.  One of them is studying in the local junior high school.  She is 41 years old and divorced. She divorced her husband many years ago, and has tried hard to raise her family alone.  She is a rice cultivator from the Prey Chor district.  She always wished to earn a higher income from her business.

Sat is doing well in her business and trying to achieve her wish. She is asking for a loan of $300 to supplement her capital and buy extra farmland to expand her farming business.  She hopes that the loan will have a positive impact on her business.

loans.use: buy extra farmland to expand her farming business.

loans.name: 030818-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga has a retail business selling dry food and goods. She is requesting a loan to to purchase dry food such as sugar, milk, candy, biscuits and goods to resell.

Nga is 28 years old and she is married with 2 children..
She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 030818-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents

In 2012, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nga has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Nga has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nga hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase dry food and goods to resell

loans.name: 030817-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xây works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

Xây is 56 years old and she is married with 1 child..
She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 030817-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

In 2011, Xây joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Xây has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Xây has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main harship that Xây faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Xây hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to buy land of her own, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Sophorn, 40, is married, resides with her husband and four school-age children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over ten years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns approximately USD 2 per day. In order to develop her business, Sophorn is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to sell to generate more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her groceries store and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degree. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her present house to provide a better living condition for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to generate more profit to support the family

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 39 years old,he is a mechanic and works in his garage. He has been in this business for 14 years and is requesting for a loan of KES. 20,000 to purchase motor vehicle spare parts and tools for use in his work. His profit will help him pay back his loan. This is his first loan from KADET LTD.

loans.use: To purchase motor vehicle spare parts and tools for use in his work.

loans.name: Rofina

texts.en:
Rofina is 35 years old lady from Vihiga County  and is married to Samwel  and they have four children.

Rofina operates a retail shop for the last 11 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 24,000. She is taking her ninth loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy retail stock like sugar and cooking fat. 

She will channel profits to repaying the loan. Her dream is educate her children.

loans.use: To buy retail stock e.g. sugar and cooking fat for sale.

loans.name: Ndoro

texts.en:
Ndoro is applying for another loan to expand his retail shop business. He will use this 30,000 Kes loan to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and detergents for resale. In the future, Ndoro aspires to continue improving his business. 

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Ndoro has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and detergents for resale.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Mrs. Hong has worked hard to improve her family's living condition. To generate a livelihood, she is engaged in the business of raising hogs, from which the main source of income is made. She has been in this business for 12 years and she is able to earn approximately 2.50 USD per day.

At the present, Mrs. Hong is requesting a loan to purchase pig feed and vitamins to keep her piglets well-grown. She hopes to get the amount she requested in order to further develop her business. With the remaining funds, she intends to purchase chickens for sale in the local market for extra revenue.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Orm

texts.en:
Orm, 32, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing rice for over 5 years and are successful in their career. Additionally, they produce noodles to sell at the market to generate more income to support the family. In order to improve her family livelihood, Orm is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase a motorbike for family use as well as to carry the noodles to sell at the market. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a pounding machine to pound the flavor to produce noodles, rebuild her present house, and support her child to study higher.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for family use as well as to carry noodles to sell at the market

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be honest and focused. Hellen operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of charcoal sources. She plans to use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more charcoal for sale. Hellen's business goal is to be a supplier of charcoal within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale

loans.name: Ngoy

texts.en:
Mr. Ngoy is 47 years old, a humble farmer as well as a sugar palm tree climber in Ang Snoul district. He has been operating this business for many years to generate his income. After he gets palm juice from the trees, he sometimes goes through the commune with his old bicycle to sell it, earning an average of $2.50 per day. He is married and has been blessed with 5 children. 
And now he would like to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for the entire family’s use. He is very happy and appreciates a constant support from our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Muslidin

texts.ru: Муслидин проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 25 лет. Он предоставляет услугу. Он в основном занимается перевозкой. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки сухофруктов (кураги). Он хочет заняться торговлей сухофруктов.
texts.en: Muslidin lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 25 years old.  He provides a service.  Muslidin is primarily involved in transportation.  He has been in this business for three years.  He is requesting this loan to buy dried fruits (dried apricots).  Muslidin wants to get involved in selling dried fruits.

loans.use: to buy dried apricots

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 33, is the mother of four children.  Together with her husband and children, she lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City.  Her husband earns an income from selling pork pies.  She supports her family by running a general store in front of her house.  She started this business nine years ago.

She would like a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of products to sell to her customers and to buy ingredients to increase her husband's production of pork pies. 

She hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy more products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: 0103013-Hợp Tân-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyện has a retail business selling fruits. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruits to resell.

Nguyện is 27 years old and she is married with 1 child.
She is the leader of a 9-member group, the 0103013-Hợp Tân-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

In 2012, Nguyện joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nguyện has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Nguyện has been involved in this business for 6 years.
The main harship that Nguyện faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nguyện hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits to resell

loans.name: Zaynalobidin

texts.ru: Зайналобидин проживает в Яванском районе. Ему 24 года. Он холост. Зайналобидин пять лет как занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет закупа бычков.
texts.en: Zaynalobidin lives in the Yavan district.  He is 24 years old and single.  Zaynalobidin has been involved in animal husbandry for five years.  He breeds cattle at home.  He is requesting this loan to buy bulls.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 36 years old and single. Alice runs a boutique in Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last nine years and gets an income of KES.11,500 per month.

She has got good credit history in KADET LTD and she is applying for her second loan of KES.30,000 from KADET LTD which she plans to buy more clothes like trousers and suits.

She will also buy tea leaves.She will use the anticipated profit to add more stock. She hopes to open a big shop.

loans.use: To  add stock of clothes like trousers, suits for sale.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a 40 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be obedient and intelligent. She operates a food stall where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located at an urban area and her primary customers are frequent customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding the food stall. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase  food ingredients such as wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat etc. Violet's business goal is to run a nice hotel within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat etc.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Mrs. Run, 53, is from Kompong Cham province. She has been residing and working there for ages. She has worked in agriculture for over 20 years, carrying out back-breaking jobs for low wages because she didn’t get a good education. Presently, she has run a small selling business to serve the people in her commune. She sells many items like household things, biscuit, soft drink, etc. She now is a mother of 5 children.
Mrs. Run needed this loan to purchase stock of merchandise and expand her store. In the future, she wants to continue and expand her business gradually.

loans.use: to purchase stock of merchandise and expand her store.

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en: Apollo is 45 years and happily married. He owns a tobacco and maize growing business. He started by growing food crops but later ventured into tobacco growing, which has improved his income. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations and high transportation costs. His family goal is to educate his children and hopes to buy more land to grow crops in the future. Apollo needs the loan to buy maize to plant.

loans.use: to buy maize to plant.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 45 year old mother from Vihiga town and is married to Leonard and they have five school-going children.

Julia operates a cafeteria business whereby she cooks food and sells to her customers. She has been in this business for the last 13 years and makes a monthly income of KES 12,000.

She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy foodstuff, like sugar, wheat, flour, and soft drinks. Her profits will be used to repay the loan. Her dream is to grow her business through KADET's loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff, such as sugar, wheat, flour and soft drinks.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 54-year-old business lady.  She is married to Charles, a businessman.  They are blessed with three children.  She has been selling cereals for the past six years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after learning about KADET from a staff member.  Alice will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans to sell in her business. 

With the anticipated profit generated from the loan, she will educate her children. Alice hopes and dreams to buy a piece of land and build a store from which to sell her grains.

loans.use: to buy dry maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 42-year-old a business lady. She is married to James, a business man. They are blessed with three children. She has been selling second hand clothes for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by an existing customer. Elizabeth will use the loan to buy stock of clothes for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to rent a house and sell her clothes without having to displace herself.

loans.use: To buy stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh is 39 years old and single. She lives with her mother in Ho Chi Minh City.

She runs a small store selling many kinds of food such as dumplings, cakes, and steamed rice with green beans, in front of her house. She has been in this business for eight years.

Binh is seeking a loan to purchase foodstuffs to increase the variety of her products for sale. This will allow her to increase her monthly profit and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase the variety of her products for sale.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is 51 years old.  She is a widow and has one son.  She lives with her son in Ho Chi Minh City.

She supports her family with the income she earns from her general store, which is located in front of the door of her house.  She intends to use her loan to buy more products such as beverages, coffee, milk, sugar and spices to sell to her customers.

Hue hopes her business runs smoothly and enables her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more products such as beverages, coffee, milk, sugar and spices to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is 48 years old and married with six children, living in Hioma,Uganda. He is a pastor and has been in service for over 20 years. His family goal is to educate his children and set up an income generating activity. Justus needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Bernard is 24 years old and he is married to Gedrine.  They are blessed with two children, one is two years old and the other is eight months old.  

He owns a bread depot and has been supplying bread for six years.  He earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES and has requested a loan of 35,000 KES in order to buy bread, cakes and cookies to sell. This is his first loan.

The profit he earns from his business will help him educate his children.

loans.use: to buy bread, cakes and cookies to sell.

loans.name: Mamatkadir

texts.ru: Маматкадир проживает в Яванском районе. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его дети находятся на заработках в России. Сам Маматкадир разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Он берет кредит для закупа бычка.
texts.en: Mamatkadir lives in the Yavan district.  He is 56 years old, married and has four children.  His children are working in Russia.  Mamatkadir breeds cattle for future sale.  He is requesting this loan to purchase a bull.

loans.use: to purchase a bull

loans.name: Bong

texts.en:
Bong is a 46-year-old married woman with three children--one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a cook.

For the past four years, she has run a food stall to cover family living expenses. She sells meals to people in her community. The business is going smoothly, and she would like a loan to buy new furniture, bowls, and chopsticks, and better quality food to provide to her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions, and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy new furniture, bowls, and chopsticks, and better quality food to provide to her customers

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 45-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in the construction field.

Huong has run a general store in front of her house for the past 15 years. She sells instant food, basic goods, and personal items for people in her community.

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing different kinds of products, such as cooking oil, seasoning powder, and sauce. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing different kinds of products, such as cooking oil, seasoning powder, and sauce
